name: Al'Akir the Windlord
how_to_get: Al'Akir the Windlord may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Windfury, Charge, Divine Shield, Taunt
flavourtext: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords. And the other three don't let him forget it.
strategy: Playing this minion will be useful at almost any time, due to the many abilities he has. However, since he has taunt it's very possible for him to die the turn after summoning, stopping you from taking too much advantage from windfury. Playing this card in conjunction with stat buffs will greatly increase survivability and damage output, for the time it's alive. This card loses almost all value when it is silenced as it becomes an 8 cost 3/5 card.

name: Alexstrasza
how_to_get: Alexstrasza may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
flavourtext: Alexstraza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone. Except Deathwing. And Malygos. And Nekros.
strategy: As a legendary 8/8 dragon for 9 mana, Alexstrasza is already a big body to deal with in anybody's deck, but her real power lies in here ability to set a hero's remaining health to 15. Due to the nature of this card, it could be used in a variety of ways as a great utility minion. First, you can play her if you are in need of a comeback and you are below 15 health-which can be a very effective way to make you way back into a close game-or you can use it to advance your lead and force your opponent down to half life while playing a devastating minion.

name: Archmage Antonidas
how_to_get: Archmage Antonidas can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Whenever you cast a spell, put a 'Fireball' spell into your hand.
flavourtext: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor. This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.
strategy: As a 7 mana 5/7 minion, the Archmage Antonidas isn't a big drop for the mana cost. His worth comes from his unique ability. Every time you cast a spell, a Fireball card is placed into your hand. This effect activates in response to casting any spell, including the Fireball cards gained in this way. If you have some way to protect him, for example with one or two taunt minions, you can easily generate 3 or even more Fireball cards. Spell damage minions can increase the benefit of this card. If you have him in your deck and you can protect him, he can easily turn a mediocre spell damage deck into a good one. He can also give you a card advantage.

name: Ashbringer
how_to_get: The Ashbringer can only be equiped through Tirion Fordring's deathrattle ability.
strategy: Late game card designed as a finisher style attack should Tirion Fordring go down. At five damage a hit with three uses it is able to cleave away half a opponents health in three rounds.

name: Baine Bloodhoof
strategy: Bain Bloodhoof is summoned by Cairne Bloodhoofs deathrattle effect, and cannot be added to your deck directly.

name: Baron Geddon
how_to_get: Baron Geddon can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
flavourtext: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.
strategy: At 7 mana for a 7/5 minion, Baron Geddon is a great card for going against decks which get out a lot of minions fast. Baron coupled with just about any other AoE card can clear the opponent's side of the board very easily. This card is also a very good game changer, and can turn the tide of a game very quickly.

name: Bloodmage Thalnos
how_to_get: Bloodmage Thalnos can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Spell Damage +1. Deathrattle: Draw a card.
flavourtext: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!
strategy: Bloodmage Thalnos is a terrific card. Not only is he great in a spellpower deck, but his deathrattle and cheap cost make him a great card to have out early, even if he dies. The disadvantage of Bloodmage Thalnos is his weak combat stats. As a 1/1 with a 2 mana cost he is susceptible to any form of direct or indirect damage. However his low combat stats can work in favour of the player, as his deathrattle allows the player to draw a card and gain a hand advantage.

name: Cairne Bloodhoof
how_to_get: Cairne Bloodhoof can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof.
flavourtext: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck. It's pretty insensitive.
strategy: Cairne Bloodhoof is a solid body. Not only is he a 4/5, which is fairly hard to kill in most cases, he also makes another 4/5 - Baine Bloodhoof - when he dies. This essentially makes him an 8/10 for 6 mana. This is by far one of the best cards to have in a beatdown-type deck. Cairne's main weakness is to effects such as silence, transform and mind control effects, which can negate his deathrattle or even turn its power to the opponent's advantage. His deathrattle makes him strong against regular attacks or removal effects.

name: Captain Greenskin
how_to_get: Captain Greenskin may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1/+1.
flavourtext: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!
strategy: Captain Greenskin is a 5 mana 5/5 minion that has the ability: Battlecry: Give your equipped weapon +1/+1. No longer as useful as before, it's the only way a rogue or hunter can increase the durability of their weapons. Previous Versions: Captain Greenskin is a 5 mana 5/5 minion that has the ability: Whenever you attack with your hero, draw a card. This makes him an effective card for any deck that has a lot of weapons. A Rogue deck is particularly good due to their hero ability, which gives them a 1/2 weapon for 2 mana. Captain Greenskin is also considered a Pirate, which means he can benefit from Southsea Captain and Captain's Parrot.

name: Cenarius
how_to_get: Cenarius may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
flavourtext: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.
strategy: Cenarius is a game-ending legendary. He is used like an 'overrun' from Magic:The Gathering in the sense that when you play him, you give your other minions +2/+2 and have enough damage to win the game wither the turn you play him, or the next. He is also very adaptable because if you have no other minions, you can chose 2 2/2 treants instead of the other ability, which gives you an opening for a come-back.

name: Deathwing
how_to_get: Deathwing can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.
flavourtext: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated. Daddy issues?
strategy: Deathwing is a very risky, but theoretically rewarding card. It is very large for its cost, but Deathwing's battlecry can be devastating to you, or your opponent. This minion is meant to end games, one way or another. The reason that it is a gamble to play this card is you could either destroy all minions and win the following turn, or you could discard your hand and be left with a single minion that could be destroyed by an Execute, Hex or Polymorph. For this reason you should be sure that they have no way of destroying Deathwing, or you could easily meet your end. Using this card when the opponents health is < 12 is the best time to play this, as you can destroy it the next turn since there will be no minions on the field, and this late in the game, even if they play a minion it's unlikely to have taunt. The later Deathwing is placed the better as your opponent is likely to have less cards in his hand meaning less opportunity for counter play.

name: DEBUG
cardtext: Debug text

name: Edwin VanCleef
how_to_get: Edwin VanCleef may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each card played earlier this turn.
flavourtext: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.
strategy: Edwin VanCleef is a card that is best for the late game. While he can be effective early, you get much more out of the combo when you can fire off several spells first. If you are planning on making a deck around Edwin VanCleef, then you should have lots of cheap spells, and lots of draw.

name: Finkle Einhorn
strategy: If you have Finkle Einhorn in play, you probably have little need of this section - you're already a strategic mastermind for defeating your opponent's The Beast! Normally after dealing with The Beast, unless you used a spell to destroy it, you will probably not have many minions on the field. Giving Finkle a buff, such as Mark of the Wild or Blessing of Kings is a good way to get back into the game. Alternatively, you could use an ability such as Fade or a minion like Shieldbearer to protect yourself.

name: Gelbin Mekkatorque
how_to_get: This card is a promotion card and cannot be crafted or disenchanted. The normal version will be craftable after full release. The golden version of this card is obtained by spending real money in the store during the game's beta test, prior to the full release of the game. After the full release of the game, the golden edition will no longer be obtainable.
cardtext: Battlecry: Summon an AWESOME invention.
flavourtext: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor. He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.
strategy: Gelbin Mekkatorque is considered to have one of the most unique abilities in the game. In addition to being unique, it can be both mutually beneficial or detrimental for you and your opponent.

name: Grommash Hellscream
how_to_get: Grom Hellscream may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Charge. Enrage: +6 Attack
flavourtext: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes! Maybe not his best decisision.
strategy: Grommash Hellscream isn't the best legendary on the block, but he is still a very good card. His high health allows him to activate his enrage more frequently than other cards, which in turn makes him almost unstoppable as an attacker, despite the fact that he looks like a defender at first glance. The charge is also very useful on top of the enrage, it allows him to be a bomb to end the game, or a card to surprise your enemy and kill his favorite minion, or even turn a game around if you are careful. A powerful combination can be used with the Inner Rage card from the warrior deck. This allows Grom to activate his enrage ability while only suffering one point of damage; effectively makes him a 12 / 8 minion.

name: Gruul
how_to_get: Gruul may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .
flavourtext: He's Gruul 'the Dragonkiller'. He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…
strategy: Gruul should be included in decks that can protect him. On each turn, both yours and opponent's, he gains +1/+1, so if he isn't gaining attack and health, he isn't worth casting.

name: Harrison Jones
how_to_get: Harrison Jones is obtained through card packs and crafting. Harrison Jones can be crafted with 1600 Arcane Dust. Harrison Jones can be disenchanted for 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
flavourtext: 'That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!'
strategy: The main purpose of Harrison Jones is to counter decks with many weapons. If used correctly he can punish overuse of weapons by your opponent, while giving you a minion as well as a card advantage. Some players may favour using the Acidic Swamp Ooze over Harrison Jones because it is a cheaper card with a similar effect. It is also easier to obtain, and more consistent if you do not run into weapon opponents often.

name: Hogger
how_to_get: Hogger can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
flavourtext: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

name: Illidan Stormrage
how_to_get: Illidan Stormrage can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of Azzinoth.
flavourtext: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years. Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

name: King Krush
how_to_get: King Krush may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Charge
flavourtext: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.
strategy: You'll want to lay this card near the end of the match, as a fast burn to the opposing hero, due to charge. This could also be used to take large minions, such as; ragnaros. Powering this up with cards such as; unleash the hounds, or alpha dire wolf will increase its damage.

name: King Mukla
cardtext: Battlecry: Give your opponent 2 Bananas.
flavourtext: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.

name: Leeroy Jenkins
how_to_get: Leeroy Jenkins may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
flavourtext: At least he has Angry Chicken.
strategy: Leeroy Jenkins is best used in a deck that can buff his attack power the turn he comes out. This typically means he is a late game play, but has uses in the mid game. Paladins can make great use of Leeroy with the Blessed Champion card.

name: Lord Jaraxxus
how_to_get: Lord Jaraxxus can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace him with Lord Jaraxxus.
flavourtext: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace him with Lord Jaraxxus.
strategy: Lord Jaraxxus, when played, transforms your hero into Lord Jaraxxus. Your health is instantly set to 15, your power is replaced by the ability INFERNO!, which allows you to summon a 6/6 Infernal every turn for 2 mana and you equip Blood Fury, a weapon with 3 attack and 8 durability. It is best used when you have less than 15 health so you regain some health. The new ability to summon 6/6 infernals in addition to Blood Fury increase your damage output every turn for a low mana cost, making it a good addition to any Warlock deck. It is best to note that Lord Jaraxxus counts as demon for the purpose of spell selections. Notably, this includes Sacrificial Pact, so an excess of caution should be exercised before playing him in a warlock mirror match. When you play Lord Jaraxxus he counts as a minion before he takes over Gul'dan, and abilities that trigger when you play a minion will affect him. (For example Snipe will deal 4 damage to him, and when he becomes the hero he will only have 11 health; Repentance will reduce his health to 1.) Additionally, a common strategy with this card involves taking a lot of punishment intentionally, so you can summon Molten Giants, and then using Jaraxxus to heal yourself. Note though that the original health of your hero will be set to 15 once you replace it with Lord Jaraxxus, meaning that summoning Molten Giant will cost more mana at Jaraxxus' 15 health (full health) than a warlock's 15 Health (down by 15 damage).

name: Lorewalker Cho
how_to_get: Lorewalker Cho can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.
flavourtext: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.
strategy: Play Lorewalker Cho to prevent your enemy from using spells against you, or just give them a taste of their own medicine. Most effective against spell-heavy decks. As a fairly vulnerable minion, ideally keep Cho well-defended to prevent your opponent from swiftly destroying him. Players playing against Cho may wish to use minions to defeat him, before then casting any planned spells. If doing so is not possible immediately, it may still be better to delay casting spells until he is defeated.Alternatively, use a single spell such as Fireball to quickly dispatch him, and suffer the consequence of supplying that single card to your enemy.

name: Malygos
how_to_get: Malygos can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Spell Damage +5
flavourtext: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic. He gets so mad!
strategy: Malygos has one main goal, spell damage. Malygos gives 5 spell damage which is the most any single card currently gives. This gives 5 power to a spell like Fireball making Fireball a 4 mana cost for 11 damage. One of the best cards for decks consisting of offensive spells. Having 12 health makes Malygos difficult to kill allowing the player to maintain the +5 spell damage for several turns. In addition to synergizing well with decks heavily utilizing spell damage Malygos' unusually high health pool allows him to benefit greatly from cards such as Divine Spirit doubling his health total, and Inner fire changing his attack to equal his life total, coupled with Temple Enforcer and or Power Word: Shield for a devastating combo. Malygos' mana cost of 9 is very high, but he can easily shift a game's momentum. Malygos can be copied by Faceless Manipulator to bring a second copy of himself onto the field. This would bring the total spell damage in play to 10.

name: Millhouse Manastorm
how_to_get: Millhouse Manastorm can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (0) next turn.
flavourtext: 'I'm gonna light you up, sweetcheeks!'
strategy: Millhouse Manastorm is meant to give you an early advantage in any game. If you play first he can be a turn 2 4/4, and if you go second he can be a turn 1 4/4. Either way he is extremely good for his cost early game. The only downside is that spells cost 0 for your opponent next turn, so you had better be careful what type of deck you play him against.

name: Nat Pagle
how_to_get: Nat Pagle can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: At the end of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw a card.
flavourtext: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman! He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).
strategy: Millhouse Manastorm is meant to give you an early advantage in any game. If you play first he can be a turn 2 4/4, and if you go second he can be a turn 1 4/4. Either way he is extremely good for his cost early game. The only downside is that spells cost 0 for your opponent next turn, so you had better be careful what type of deck you play him against.

name: Nozdormu
how_to_get: Nozdormu can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.
flavourtext: Time to write some flavor text.
strategy: At 9 mana for a 8/8 minion, Nozdormu appears to be a strong card to throw into just about any hero's deck. Its true power lies in its unique ability to cut a 90-second turn for both players into a 15-second turn. As soon as Nozdormu is summoned to the battlefield the pace of a game quickens in such a way that the opponent may become flustered and rush their thoughts and make mistakes from such pressure, allowing the fast-thinking players to succeed most when playing this card. A user of Nozdormu may want to sustain the fast pace the great dragon brings to the battle with Stealth shrouding it from your opponent's removal cards such as Polymorph, Hex or even Hunter's Mark. A Rogue deck can succeed in this strategy by using Conceal in the same turn you summon Nozdormu, allowing you at least one good attack with the dragon aspect as well as at least one more 15-second turn for your opponent to hopefully make more mistakes with.

name: Old Murk-Eye
how_to_get: Old Murk-Eye may be received through a quest reward when you collect all other murloc cards in the game. It cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Charge. Has +1 Attack for each other Murloc on the battlefield.
flavourtext: He's a legend among murlocs. 'Mrghllghghllghg!', they say.
strategy: These cards can be used to buff other minions of the same subtype, or gain buffs from murlocs on the field.

name: Onyxia
how_to_get: Onyxia may be received through opening Hearthstone booster packs and crafting 1600 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
flavourtext: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor. You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.
strategy: The main power of Onyxia is swarming your opponent with 1/1 whelps. With such a powerful Battlecry Onyxia has the potential to be one of the greatest game-changers in the game. This is because the more behind you are,(the fewer minions you have,) the more you will recieve when Onyxia comes into play. Onyxia is especially useful for druids, when played in combination with the Soul of the Forest card, which will make all whelps summon a 2/2 treant when they die.

name: Prophet Velen
how_to_get: Prophet Velen is obtained through card packs and crafting. Prophet Velen can be crafted with 1600 Arcane Dust. Prophet Velen can be disenchanted for 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
flavourtext: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.
strategy: Prophet Velen can dramatically increase the Priest's effectiveness in the late-game. Prophet Velen's passive currently effects the Priest's hero ability as well. This buff is in both priest Shadowform and Healing form. Remember this card should be considered to have a soft taunt. Your enemy will go through great lengths to kill Velen due to the power he brings in the late game. Be prepared to protect him with taunt minions, healing or divine shields.

name: Ragnaros the Firelord
how_to_get: Ragnaros the Firelord can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Can't Attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
flavourtext: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord. Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.
strategy: Because Ragnaros deals 8 damage when your turn ends, he can easily work as removal, while remaining a persistent threat. Due to how he attacks, Ragnaros will not take damage, and can be used to destroy powerful minions without losing him, although the targets of his attacks are random. Silencing Ragnaros allows him to attack normally. Keeping Ragnaros alive is essential to success if you have him out.

name: Sylvanas Windrunner
how_to_get: Sylvanas Windrunner can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.
flavourtext: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.
strategy: Sylvanas Windrunner is a card that can easily change a game, quickly. With her Deathrattle it is very easy to make yourself very powerful and crush your opponent with their few remaining forces after Sylvanas Windrunner is dead. But beware, she can be useless if you are in a bad situation, as she will be targeted as soon as possible and you will probably get nothing of value for 5 mana.

name: The Beast
how_to_get: The Beast may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
flavourtext: He lives in Blackrock Mountain. He eats Gnomes. That's pretty much it.
strategy: ' The Beast is a powerful late game minion that comes with the unique ability of Death Rattle. The Beast synergizes exceptionally well in hunter decks that focus on the use of beast type minions. Being a mostly offensive creature, it is best to protect it with creatures that use Taunt or other minions that can grant it Charge when summoned. This is especially true when considering upon death, it grants your opponent Finkle Einhorn who is a 3/3 creature. Try to Silence The Beast with a card like Ironbeak Owl, for example, to prevent your opponent from gaining Finkle if The Beast dies.

name: The Black Knight
how_to_get: The Black Knight may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt.
flavourtext: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament. We can pretty much mark that a failure.
strategy: The Black Knight is a minion meant to start some game-ending momentum. He gets a taunt minion out of the way so that you may begin hitting your enemy as soon as possible. As a utility, he is very good, as most people buff their best minions with taunt as to kill any minions that would try to attack them.

name: Tinkmaster Overspark
how_to_get: Tinkmaster Overspark can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Transform a minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel at random.
flavourtext: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.
strategy: Tinkmaster Overspark is a very risky card with almost unpredictable outcomes but it still can be controlled to some degree. This card is best played early in the game. Regardless of which creature is summoned, the result is a silenced minion. Overspark's ability is particularly useful when used on friendly 1/1 minions or large enemy minions, as you have a 50% chance in either case to gain a substantial benefit. When used upon an enemy which is greater than 5/5, or which has useful card text or enchantments, the effect is almost guaranteed to be beneficial.s

name: Tirion Fordring
how_to_get: Tirion Fordring may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs, as a reward from arena or, crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Divine Shield. Taunt. Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3 Ashbringer.
flavourtext: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.
strategy: Tirion Fordring is a 8 mana, 6/6 minion with 3 abilities: Divine Shield, Taunt and Deathrattle. These abilities make Tirion a powerful card for any Paladin deck. Not only can Tirion shield himself from one attack with Divine Shield, he also forces the enemy to attack him due to his Taunt! If Tirion does happen to die, he leaves a lasting mark on the game with his Deathrattle ability, which summons Ashbringer, a 5 attack, 3, durability weapon for your paladin.

name: Ysera
cardtext: At the end of your turn, draw a Dream Card.
flavourtext: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream. Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?
strategy: Ysera is usually used, not for its power, but for its ability. The fact that it has 12 health makes it very hard to kill, which means that you can essentially wipe your enemy's field with the dream cards that you get every turn. In other words, the longer Ysera is out, the fewer minions that you have to kill before you can kill your opponent. Dream can also be used to trigger effects such as Battlecry multiple times, which can lead you to an easy victory.

name: Adrenaline Rush
how_to_get: This card was removed from the game.
cardtext: Draw a card. Combo: Draw 2 cards instead.
flavourtext: Rogues don't need to jump from the top of the 1000 Needles to get a burst of adrenaline.
strategy: This card could be used | Twilight Drake to add +1/+1 or +2/+2 if you played another card previously.

name: Ancient of Lore
how_to_get: Ancient of Lore can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Choose One - Draw 2 cards; or Restore 5 Health.
flavourtext: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.
strategy: As a Choose One effect, choose which effect will benefit you the most. If you have 25 or less health then healing 5 health with Ancient Secrets is useful to repair damage your opponent has worked for. Being able to draw two cards with Ancient Teachings is also very powerful and should be used to increase card advantage when you are ahead.

name: Ancient of War
how_to_get: Ancient of War can be obtained from booster packs and crafting 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Choose One - Taunt and +5 Health; or +5 Attack.
flavourtext: Young Night Elves love to play 'Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?' You lose if you get crushed to death.

name: Avenging Wrath
cardtext: Deal 8 damage randomly split among enemy characters.
flavourtext: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!
strategy: A card that deals 8 damage for 6 mana is a card that should not be taken lightly. Whether facing an opponent that has a full board of creatures, or a caster that relies on spell damage or their hero alone, having an empowered version of the mage card Arcane Missiles is powerful. For a full stacked board against you, Avenging Wrath is best paired with Equality to ensure all their minions are cleared. Also, with spell power minions Avenging Wrath can shoot additional missiles to hit the enemy even harder. Due to its unpredictability, the card is normally subbed out for Holy Wrath in a mana intensive deck, but each has their merits.

name: Bane of Doom
how_to_get: Bane of Doom can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Deal 2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
flavourtext: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.
strategy: Battlecry effects are only activated when a minion is played from the hand, and will not be activated through Bane of Doom.

name: Bestial Wrath
how_to_get: Bestial Wrath is obtained through card packs and crafting. Bestial Wrath can be crafted with 400 Arcane Dust. Bestial Wrath can be disenchanted for 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Give a Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
flavourtext: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface. Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.
strategy: Bestial Wrath is an excellent addition to any Hunter deck. It is extremely useful for buffing up one of your minions to take down a large threat on your opponent's side of the field without losing your own minion. Make sure you play enough beasts in your deck to cast it reliably. One of the best minions to use with Bestial Wrath is Young Dragonhawk. Windfury effectively doubles the damage bonus while the Immune effect allows it to survive combat with opposing minions.

name: Big Game Hunter
how_to_get: The Big Game Hunter can be either made with 400 Arcane Dust or received from booster packs.
cardtext: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more.
flavourtext: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him. Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.
strategy: Big Game Hunter is a very unique card in its ability to destroy an opposing minion for such a low price. The alternative is a 4/2 for 3, which is also acceptable, especially if your opponent is utilising low-power and high-health early-game minions.

name: Blood Knight
how_to_get: Blood Knight can be obtained from booster packs and crafting 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
flavourtext: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.
strategy: This 3/3 card for 3 mana can be an incredible game-changer. If played while Minions with Divine Shield are on the board he removes all existing ones and buffs himself with +3/+3 per shield removed. So if 3 minions are on the board with Divine Shield he would become a +12/+12 for 3 mana. Very good in a Paladin deck or playing versus a Paladin.

name: Brawl
cardtext: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
flavourtext: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?
strategy: Brawl is one of the most difficult to play cards in Hearthstone. By its very nature it costs you all of your minions on the board, minus a chance that it will be your minion that is chosen randomly to remain alive. When played at the wrong time, it can lead to a quick defeat, but where it shines is in denying opponent strategies with 4-6 turn preparation times such as minion zerging with Divine Shield. At only a 5 mana crystal cost (4 if you're lucky and draw The Coin) it can also be used as a hard wipe in situations where your starting draw is significantly weaker than your opponents or you are confident that his greatest threat has been played on the board.

name: Cabal Shadow Priest
how_to_get: Cabal Shadow Priest can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
flavourtext: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

name: Captain's Parrot
how_to_get: Captain's Parrot is a reward for collecting every pirate card. Golden Captain's Parrot is a reward for collecting every golden pirate card. Captain's Parrot is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Battlecry: Put a random Pirate from your deck into your hand.
flavourtext: Pirates and Parrots go together like Virmen and Carrots.
strategy: Captain's Parrot is only desirable in a deck featuring other pirate cards. The card relies on some RNG, but can still be quite powerful when used at the proper time. Alternatively 2x Captain's Parrot can be used with a single powerful pirate card in order to stack the odds of getting the card in your hand.

name: Doomhammer
how_to_get: Doomhammer is a Shaman only card obtained from opening booster packs, or crafted with 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Windfury, Overload: (2)
flavourtext: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall. His name is a total coincidence.
strategy: With this weapon you can attack twice a turn with your hero, but each time your hero attacks it still uses one of the durability from this weapon. So, if you attacked with this weapon as often as you could, you could only attack with it for four rounds, not eight. Still, from this one card you can get out up to 16 total damage, targeted in 2 damage chunks making it very card efficient. When using this card, along with other overload cards you need to plan your mana usage not only for the current turn, but the next. Doomhammer has strong synergy with Rockbiter Weapon and Captain Greenskin.

name: Doomsayer
how_to_get: Doomsayer may be received through opening Hearthstone booster packs and crafting with 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: At the start of your turn, destroy ALL minions.
flavourtext: He's almost been right so many times. He was sure it was coming during the Cataclysm.
strategy: The Doomsayer has a low cost and a unique ability: at the start of your every turn, he will destroy ALL minions. This effect will clear the board of all minions on both sides. With 7 health, he can take some punishment before dying, allowing him to do his job. Obviously, this card shouldn't be included in a deck that depends on minions as the primary source of damage, but it may be able to shut down an opposing deck that depends on minions.

name: Earth Elemental
how_to_get: Earth Elemental can be obtained from booster packs and crafting with 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Taunt. Overload: (3)
flavourtext: Nothing beats rock
strategy: As a 5 mana 7/8 minion with taunt the Earth Elemental provides both strong defensive and offensive skills. The drawback being the 3 mana overload cost which can come back to haunt you if you get countered or the Earth Elemental gets crowd controlled. The combo of dropping the Earth Elemental and buffing him with windfury the next turn makes for a swift game-changer. Overall a very strong epic card.

name: Faceless Manipulator
how_to_get: Faceless Manipulator can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
flavourtext: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.
strategy: Faceless Manipulator can copy any minion card, including legendary minions. It also copies any abilities or conditions that the copied minion has, including previously inflicted damage; for example, copying Malygos will create an additional +5 Spell Damage making a total of 10 Spell Damage in play. Buffs are also copied. Keep in mind that in the same way that taking control of an enemy minion does not grant you their Battlecry effect, faceless manipulator does not trigger the Battlecry of its target.

name: Far Sight
how_to_get: Far Sight can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.
flavourtext: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.
strategy: Useful in shaman decks with a majority of cards that cost 3 mana or more, like Hex or Lava Burst. It allows the shaman to get to the cards in his deck faster but forces him to play the card drawn or waste the mana spent in this spell.

name: Force of Nature
how_to_get: Force of Nature can be obtained through booster packs or crafting
cardtext: Summon three 2/2 Treants with Charge that die at the end of the turn.
flavourtext: 'I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!' - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

name: Gladiator's Longbow
how_to_get: Gladiator's Longbow is obtained through card packs and crafting. Gladiator's Longbow can be crafted with 400 Arcane Dust. Gladiator's Longbow can be disenchanted for 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Your hero is Immune while attacking.
flavourtext: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.
strategy: Gladiator's Longbow is an excellent card. Its immunity affect means that it is useful for wearing down opposing taunt minions, clearing a path for your heavy hitters to strike at the enemy hero, or it can be used to take out opposing minions that greatly threaten you, such as the Core Hound.

name: Gorehowl
cardtext: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
flavourtext: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe. Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession. Quite the mystery!
strategy: This card is best used to destroy minions. It is possible through the use of Upgrade! and similar effects to increase its durability thus making it a useful weapon against enemy heroes as well. You can also make use of the very high Attack of this weapon with cards such as Bloodsail Raider and Charge.

name: Hungry Crab
how_to_get: Hungry Crab can be found in card packs or created using the crafting system
cardtext: Battlecry: Destroy a Murloc and gain +2/+2.
flavourtext: Murloc. It's what's for dinner.
strategy: Hungry crab is particularly effective against popular murloc zerg strategies. Playing a Hungry Crab in a murloc deck is a risky play. When Murloc buffs are active, a 1-cost Murloc is certainly superior: you get two buffed Murlocs instead of one 3/4 Hungry Crab. However, in situations where you drew badly or your buffing Murlocs have been removed, a 3/4 Hungry Crab can provide decent staying power. As such, this card's utility in a Murloc deck will vary immensely from game to game and some playstyles will benefit more than others.

name: Ice Block
how_to_get: Ice Block can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.
flavourtext: Ice is nice, and will suffice!
strategy: Can be very effective as an endgame surprise and can be a clutch game saver, giving you one more guaranteed turn. Not rated as highly as other mage secrets due to the criteria required for the card to trigger. Since this secret will only trigger once your health gets below 1, playing this card with the Ethereal Arcanist is a fairly strong mid-game Combo, giving the minion continual +2/+2 boosts.

name: Kidnapper
how_to_get: Kidnapper may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand
flavourtext: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

name: Lay on Hands
how_to_get: Lay on Hands can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Restore #8 Health. Draw 3 cards.
flavourtext: A grammatically awkward life saver.
strategy: Lay on Hands is a late-game oriented card. In most scenarios, it should be used after taking big damage from a player. This card is highly valued by some, not only for its game sustain, but for its draw power as well. Unfortunately this can often only prolong a lost game, but it is a great top deck for tricky situations.

name: Mindgames
cardtext: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
flavourtext: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.
strategy: If you play Mindgames and your opponent has no minions left in his deck you will summon a Shadow of Nothing to the field. For 4 mana, this card will most likely copy a minion with a lower cost, unless the opponent's deck has a flat mana curve. It also gives some limited information on the opponent's deck.

name: Molten Giant
how_to_get: The Molten Giant is obtained via booster packs and crafting 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.
flavourtext: He gets terrible heartburn. BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.
strategy: Molten Giants have the best synergy in Warlock-based decks or decks that revolve around Health manipulation. With their Hero Power 'Life Tap', Warlock players are able draw cards at a quicker rate as well as self-inflict damage to lower the casting cost of the unit. Adding one or two Molten Giants coupled with cheap taunters such as Sen'jin Shieldmasta will guarantee you heavy hitters as early as mid-game while at the same time protect your lowered Health Points from further weapon or minion attacks. Add Drain Life and Siphon Soul, for Health Point regeneration after using this combo. Coupled with Lord Jaraxxus to make the best out of Health manipulation decks. Priest, Druid, and Paladin decks are all able to use Molten Giants with some success due to their healing cards and abilities..

name: Mountain Giant
how_to_get: Mountain Giant is obtained through card packs and crafting. Mountain Giant can be crafted with 400 Arcane Dust. Mountain Giant can be disenchanted for 100 Arcane Dust. Mountain Giant Golden is obtained through card packs and crafting. Mountain Giant Golden can be crafted with 1600 Arcane Dust. Mountain Giant Golden can be disenchanted for 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
flavourtext: His mother said that he was just big boned.
strategy: This card works well in card draw deck, such as warlock decks, because of its ability that reduces the mana cost based on the number of cards in your hand.

name: Murloc Warleader
how_to_get: Murloc Warleader may be received through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafted using 400 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: ALL other Murlocs have +2/+1.
flavourtext: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound? Nope! Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!
strategy: The Murloc Warleader is a perfect card for ensuring that the murlocs you have hit harder and stay on the board longer. The Murloc Tidehunter becomes especially deadly, becoming a 4/2 minion who brings a 3/2 minion along. Care must be taken when using this card and the Coldlight Seer, since they will buff murlocs belonging to your opponent. If you wanna try to make Murloc deck, it's better to use this card only when you already have some murloc minions on the battlefield to make Murloc Warleader as much usefull, as possible.

name: Patient Assassin
how_to_get: Patient Assassin can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Stealth. Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
flavourtext: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.
strategy: While nonthreatening at first glance, Patient Assassin possesses the Poison ability, allowing him to instantly kill any card he can damage. He also comes onto the field with stealth which makes him unable to be targeted by attacks or spells. Patient Assassin can be left on the field to dissuade your opponent from playing powerful cards until he is disposed of. Although, it should be noted that he can be killed by an enemy spell that targets all minions, such as Arcane Explosion.

name: Pit Lord
how_to_get: Can be obtained by opening packs or crafting with 400 Arcane Dust
cardtext: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero.
flavourtext: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.
strategy: Like many Warlock demons, the Pit Lord comes with a heavy drawback to offset its low cost. Although you get a 5/6 for a mere 4 mana, the drawback is that the Pit Lord deals 5 damage to you. Care must be taken when summoning this demon, as it can do more harm than good. The Pit Lord can be a game decider, if your opponent finishes him off as soon as you play him, you're in deep trouble.

name: Placeholder Card
cardtext: Battlecry: Someone remembers to publish this card.

name: Preparation
cardtext: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.
flavourtext: 'Be Prepared' - Rogue Motto

name: Pyroblast
how_to_get: Pyroblast can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Deal 10 damage.
flavourtext: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.
strategy: As an 8 mana, 10 damage spell, Pyroblast can be used to great effect for finishing off your opponent. The threat of a surprise Pyroblast forces your opponent to always stay above 10 health. In combination with Fireball and some spell damage minions, you can deal 20 damage in a turn. The card usage is only valuable in the very late game due to its high mana cost, allowing for combos to surprise your opponent and turn the tide of a battle (such as dropping an Ironbeak Owl, silencing their Taunt card and finishing the game with your creatures + Pyroblast).

name: Sea Giant
how_to_get: Sea Giant may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.
flavourtext: See? Giant.
strategy: The Sea Giant works excellently in decks that focus primarily on getting many minions out onto the field quickly, as that allows the Sea Giant rapidly enter the field.

name: Shadow of Nothing
how_to_get: Shadow of Nothing is an Epic card belonging to the priest deck. It is earned from a card pack or crafting with Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Mindgames whiffed! Your opponent had no minions!
strategy: At 0 mana, Shadow of Nothing is used after playing Mindgames which makes a copy of a minion from your opponent's deck.

name: Shadowform
cardtext: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage'. If already in Shadowform: 3 damage.
flavourtext: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?
strategy: This is more powerful than it might appear at first glance. 2 'untauntable' damage that can be targeted at anything is better than any other offensive base ability. Just remember you're trading a reliable source of healing synergies.

name: Shield Slam
how_to_get: Shield Slam can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
flavourtext: 'What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?' - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9
strategy: Shield Slam has incredible synergy with the warrior card Shield Block and their hero power Armor Up!. It's not uncommon for a warrior to have at least 5 or more armor, meaning Shield Slam is usually capable of easily killing strong minions for only 1 mana.

name: Snake Trap
how_to_get: Snake Trap is obtained through card packs and crafting. Snake Trap can be crafted with 400 Arcane Dust. Snake Trap can be disenchanted for 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.
flavourtext: Why did it have to be snakes?
strategy: Snake Trap works well in conjunction with Starving Buzzard. If you are able to get your opponent to trigger Snake Trap while Starving Buzzard is on the field, you will draw 3 cards. You also use Snake Trap in conjunction with Scavenging Hyena and sacrifice your Snakes by attacking enemy minions in order to possibly buff your Scavenging Hyena with an extra 6 attack and 3 health. Another great card to combo this with is Frostwolf Warlord as it will receive the bonus for every snake on your side of the board.

name: Southsea Captain
how_to_get: Southsea Captain can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Your other Pirates have +1/+1.
flavourtext: When he saves enough plunder, he's going to comission an enormous captain's hat. He has hat envy.
strategy: Southsea Captain's only real purpose is being the staple of a pirate deck. He is able to give other pirates +1/+1 which would classify him as a 'lord' in most TCGs. He is most useful when you have a high number of pirates out and you need to keep them alive or do extra damage. Although Southsea Captain provides synergy with other pirate type cards, devoting an entire deck to pirates is not ideal. This is due to the fact that there are simply not enough pirate cards yet. Another option for creating a themed deck is to build it around Murlocs.

name: Spellbender
cardtext: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target.
flavourtext: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild. It just feels meaner. And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

name: Sword of Justice
how_to_get: Sword of Justice can be obtained through booster packs or crafting.
cardtext: Whenever you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.
flavourtext: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!
strategy: The Sword of Justice has the unique ability of buffing any summoned minions with +1/+1 at the cost of one of it's durability points. It is best not to use the weapon to attack with directly, to allow all of the durability to be used for the buff. This synergizes well with the paladin's class ability of Reinforce. It can only be used in Paladin decks.

name: Twisting Nether
how_to_get: Twisting Nether can be obtained through opening Expert packs or created using the crafting system.
cardtext: Destroy all minions.
flavourtext: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.
strategy: A very situational card because of the fact it has a high mana cost AND destroys all minions on the board, including your own. Ideally you want to play this when destroying your opponents minions out weighs the loss of your own.

name: Abomination
how_to_get: Abomination can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to ALL characters.
flavourtext: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.
strategy: The Abomination is a monstrous minion that can be used both offensively and defensively. Just having it on the field will stop many strategies, particularly low-health minion zerging strategies right in their tracks due to the deadliness of its deathrattle ability.

name: Alarm-o-Bot
how_to_get: Alarm-o-Bot can be obtained by opening booster packs or crafting.
cardtext: At the start of your turn, swap this minion with a random one in your hand.
flavourtext: WARNING. WARNING. WARNING.
strategy: Use Alarm-o-Bot to get a minion with a large mana cost into play earlier or avoid detrimental Battlecry effects. You can place Alarm-o-Bot and at the beginning of your next turn, it will swap with a random minion in your hand. To use to maximum effectiveness, protect the Alarm-o-Bot with another Taunt card and play all other minions. Keep the minion you want to place, preferably with the highest mana cost, with no other minions to guarantee the Alarm-o-Bot summon. You can repeat this over again as Alarm-o-Bot get replaced back into your hand. This is a great way to summon high value minions for only the cost of 3 mana! Make sure you protect your Alarm-o-Bot or else his effect will not come into play.

name: Aldor Peacekeeper
cardtext: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.
flavourtext: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.
strategy: Aldor Peacekeeper's Battlecry can be used to make it easier to remove tough enemy minions. This is particularly useful for getting rid of enemy minions with high health points and the ability to Taunt.

name: Ancestral Spirit
cardtext: Choose a minion. When that minion is destroyed, return it to the battlefield.
flavourtext: It was just a flesh wound.

name: Ancient Mage
how_to_get: Ancient Mage is obtained through card packs and crafting. Ancient Mage can be crafted with 100 Arcane Dust. Ancient Mage can be disenchanted for 20 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Spell Damage +1.
flavourtext: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.
strategy: Ancient Mage's mana cost of 4 is too high for its combat stats of 2/5, but the ability, on the other hand, is amazing. By placing Ancient Mage in between two other minions, you can potentially gain 2 spell power which would give 2 power to spells like Fireball, making Fireball a 4 mana cost for 8 damage. Ancient Mage is an excellent tool for decks consisting of many spells.

name: Ancient Watcher
how_to_get: Ancient Watcher can be found in card packs or created using the Crafting system.
cardtext: Can't Attack.
flavourtext: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?
strategy: The Ancient Watcher comes into play with 4/5 but an inability to attack and may be used in a number of ways. Abilities that give minions taunt such as Sunfury Protector, Fade, Defender of Argus and Mark of the Wild make it one of the cheapest mana:hp investments for a taunt tank. Another option is to to cast a Silence which removes the inability to Attack and make it a potent attacking minion in its own right. Additionally, the Ancient Watcher can be useful as a low cost sacrifical minion for warlocks to use with Shadowflame and Void Terror.

name: Angry Chicken
cardtext: Enrage: +5 Attack.
flavourtext: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.
strategy: This minion is best used with abilities or other minions that increase its total health. Without increasing the total health this minion is often strictly worse than most other one mana costed minions. For this reason, this minion is best played in a deck filled with minion improvements. Once the health is increased and the enrage effect is triggered, this minion combos well with other effects such as Taunt for strong clearing power or Windfury for massive damage.

name: Arcane Golem
how_to_get: Arcane Golem can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Charge. Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
flavourtext: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.
strategy: Arcane Golem is a relatively cheap summon but comes at the price of giving your opponent a mana crystal.

name: Argent Commander
cardtext: Charge, Divine Shield
flavourtext: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.
strategy: This is one of two 6 Mana Minions with Charge you can choose from. The other one being the Reckless Rocketeer. This leaves you with the choice between 1 more Attack or Divine Shield and one more Health. In most cases you should opt for the Argent Commander since he basically gives you a free Attack into anything, regardless of its damage potential, and lets you deal quickly with, for example, high-damage Taunt Creatures.

name: Armorsmith
how_to_get: Armorsmith can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.
flavourtext: She accepts guild funds for repairs!
strategy: This minion is very well suited to a defensive warrior deck. By using this minion alongside other minions that have a combination of high health and taunt, it allows the warrior to stack large amounts of armor, which combines extremely well with the warrior card Shield Slam. The Armorsmith is a powerful card capable of contributing large amounts of Armor to the summoning hero. For this reason opponents will almost always want to remove her as quickly as possible. Summoning warriors should do their best to shield their Armorsmiths. It goes without saying that having an Armorsmith in play greatly rewards the warrior for creating as much carnage as possible, making cards like Whirlwind a lot more desirable.

name: Auchenai Soulpriest
cardtext: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
flavourtext: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.
strategy: Auchenai Soulpriest is a very interesting card strategically with the ability to turn the tables in a tough match by changing the priest's many healing abilities into strong damaging spells. It's worth mentioning that the commonly used board wipe spell Holy Nova will now damage your minions instead of healing them while an Auchenai Soulpriest is active on your side.

name: Azure Drake
how_to_get: Azure Drake can be found in card packs or crafted for 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Spell Damage +1. Battlecry: Draw a card.
flavourtext: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.
strategy: Azure Drake is very mana efficient 4/4 minion that gives 1 spell power , which can be used for adding 1 power to a spell card like Fireball. The battlecry allows you to draw a card to gain card advantage. While Azure Drake may be most useful in decks containing many offensive spells, the combat stats alone with battlecry make Azure Drake a very well rounded card that could be an asset to any deck.

name: Bite
how_to_get: Bite can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn and 4 Armor.
flavourtext: Chew your food!
strategy: A stronger version of the Claw spell, Bite should most often be used for minion removal. The armor it provides allows the Druid to deal with mid-ranged minions on his own, usually taking no retaliation damage. If used in conjunction with the Druid's Shapeshift ability, he is able to handle minions of 5 health. In a pinch, this spell can be used to deal 4 damage directly to the opposing hero.

name: Blade Flurry
cardtext: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemies.
flavourtext: 'Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast. It's a lot more complicated than that.' - Shan, Rogue Trainer
strategy: Potentially a very effective area of effect attack for only 2 mana. However, note that its effectiveness hinges entirely upon your weapon. Ideally, equip Assassin's Blade or Perdition's Blade to make the most of this spell. If this is not possible, rogues can use it with their hero power-generated Wicked Knife, but will waste much of the potential power of this spell. This spell's effect is also increased by spell damage bonuses, as well of course as weapon improvements from cards such as Deadly Poison and Spiteful Smith.

name: Blessed Champion
how_to_get: The Blessed Champion card is a Paladin Rare Card from Expert Set of cards and obtained from Card Packs or by Crafting.
cardtext: Double a minion's Attack.
flavourtext: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

name: Blizzard
how_to_get: Blizzard can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.
flavourtext: This spell can be very Entertaining.
strategy: Blizzard's mass-freeze mechanic coupled with its 2 AoE damage can make it a deadly mass-removal card. Keep in mind that freeze only affects a minion's ability to attack, and silencing a frozen minion will remove the freeze effect.

name: Bloodsail Corsair
how_to_get: Bloodsail Corsair can be found in card packs or crafted for 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
flavourtext: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers. It's called the 'Pirate's Code'.
strategy: Play Bloodsail Corsair at the beginning of your turn to weaken your opponent's offense and gain significant advantage. This card can mean the difference between mitigating or suffering extra damage during your opponent's turn. This effect is extremely useful against the Warrior, especially if Gorehowl is his Weapon of choice.

name: Coldlight Oracle
how_to_get: The Coldlight Oracle is obtained by opening packs. The Coldlight Oracle can be crafted with 100 Arcane Dust or 800 Arcane Dust for the Golden version.
cardtext: Battlecry: Each player draws 2 cards.
flavourtext: They can see the future. In that future both players draw more cards. Spoooky.
strategy: As a 3 mana 2/2 minion, the Coldlight Oracle provides a small minion of the Murloc classification. Other minions in this classification have abilities that affect other Murlocs. The Coldlight Oracle battlecry is a significant source of draw power, but has the downside of also giving your opponent draw power. In combination with cards that return minions to your hand, like Shadowstep, it is possible to fill your hand quickly by playing the Coldlight Oracle multiple times. If this is done while you or your opponent have a full hand, any cards drawn will be displayed and destroyed, so it is possible to use this card to 'mill' your opponents deck. Coldight Oracle can be used as a 'last resort' to get draw immediately. Since Murloc decks often rely on winning the game early this card can be used to gain additional draw power to go on the offensive sooner.

name: Coldlight Seer
how_to_get: Coldlight Seer can be obtained from card packs or by crafting. It can be crafted with 100 Arcane Dust or 800 Arcane Dust for the Golden version.
cardtext: Battlecry: Give ALL other Murlocs +2 Health.
flavourtext: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths. So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.
strategy: To maximize it's effectiveness, play the Coldlight Seer after any other murloc you want to buff. The +2 health won't be applied on murlocs summoned later. Note that it affects your murlocs, as well as the enemy's. Unlike the Murloc Warleader the Ability of the Coldlight Seer is a Battlecry. This allows you to use it in combination with the Youthful Brewmaster to double the effect of its Ability.

name: Commanding Shout
cardtext: Your minions can't be reduced below 1 Health this turn. Draw a card.
flavourtext: 'Shout! Shout! Let it all out!' - Advice to warriors-in-training
strategy: Commanding shout can be used to let your minions attack your opponent's without any risk of your own minions dying. It can also be used to trigger a Hunter's Explosive Trap or kill an Abomination without losing any minions.

name: Counterspell
how_to_get: Counterspell can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
flavourtext: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't? The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.
strategy: Counterspell may be used preemptively to block the next spell cast by an opponent. It's worth noting that the spell is simply blocked and not reflected to the opponent. Despite the spell being blocked, it is still considered to have successfully completed casting. The spell card will still be consumed and its mana cost expended. Minions which provide effects in response to spells being cast (such as Mana Wyrm) will also still trigger from the countered spell, as will rogue combo effects. However, overload effects on shaman cards will not be triggered. When attempting to counter Counterspell, trying casting a weak or unimportant spell first.

name: Crazed Alchemist
how_to_get: This card can be obtained through crafting or randomly from card packs with a possibility of becoming a Golden Rare. Crazed Alchemist can be crafted with 100 Arcane Dust. Crazed Alchemist can be disenchanted for 20 Arcane Dust. Golden Crazed Alchemist can be crafted with 800 Arcane Dust. Golden Crazed Alchemist can be disenchanted for 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.
flavourtext: 'You'll love my new recipe!' he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.
strategy: The Crazed Alchemist is a very versatile card that can be used both offensively and defensively. For example, a player can utilize the Crazed Alchemist's Battlecry on their Oasis Snapjaw on the field to do a massive 7 damage. On the other end of the spectrum, the Crazed Alchemist's Battlecry can be used on minions such as the Doomsayer as a form of removal.

name: Defender of Argus
how_to_get: Defender of Argus can be found in card packs or created using the crafting system.
cardtext: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt.
flavourtext: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending. But it does.

name: Demolisher
how_to_get: Demolisher can be found in card packs or created using the crafting system
cardtext: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
flavourtext: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone. It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.
strategy: Demolisher is a card with a powerful effect if left unplay unchecked. It's ability can target minions and heroes alike giving it a steady stream of damage output. The random nature of the card means that you cannot influence what it hits other than by eliminating possible targets. Despite the random nature, applying 2 damage to any enemy minion or hero is a valuable asset and as a result will quickly be targetted by minions unless protected with Taunt minions and even then will be a likely target for removal spells or silence.

name: Divine Favor
how_to_get: Divine Favor can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.
flavourtext: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like a helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!
strategy: Card drawing power is very sought after in Hearthstone and this card for only 3 mana can give you a huge advantage. Works best in a high-speed deck, in which you play cards at a higher speed making you have several cards less than your opponent, giving you multiple cards when you play Divine Favor and all that for only 3 mana.

name: Doomguard
how_to_get: Doomguard can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Charge. Battlecry: Discard two random cards.
flavourtext: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.
strategy: Doomguard is a fairly cost efficient minion with charge, however the card's battlecry makes it a painful card for the Warlock to play. The best uses of the doomguard are in rushing decks where you plan to win in the first 5-6 turns, or it can be used as a finisher, this way avoiding the card disadvantage that could ruin the warlock's end-game.

name: Eaglehorn Bow
how_to_get: Eaglehorn Bow is obtained through card packs and crafting. Eaglehorn Bow can be crafted with 100 Arcane Dust. Eaglehorn Bow can be disenchanted for 20 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Whenever a Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.
flavourtext: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.
strategy: The Eaglehorn Bow is an excellent card for Hunter decks, especially those that heavily specialize in Secrets. The increased durability this card receives whenever a secret is revealed will almost guarantee that you will almost constantly have a weapon available to harass your enemy with.

name: Emperor Cobra
how_to_get: Emperor Cobra can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
flavourtext: The Scholozar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray. And plate armor.
strategy: While the Emperor Cobra's stats are nothing impressive, it possesses the Poison ability: any minion damaged by it is destroyed. Abilities like the shaman spell Ancestral Healing or priest spell Fade, or minions that give other minions taunt like Sunfury Protector, Houndmaster or Defender of Argus can give you a snake that will instantly kill any attacker. Even the mighty Deathwing is not safe from the Emperor Cobra.

name: Equality
how_to_get: Equality can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Change the Health of ALL minions to 1.
flavourtext: We are all special unique snowflakes... with 1 Health.
strategy: Equality should be saved for when the drawback of having the health of all your minions set to 1 is outweighed by the benefit of doing the same to your opponent. It can be a good idea to follow up this card with Consecration, which will wipe out all of the opponents minions. Be careful when playing this against a mage because they have Arcane Explosion that can kill all your minions that you just converted to 1 health and Arcane Missiles that can potentially kill 3 or more (if they play some creature that increases spell damage) of your minions with 1 health.

name: Ethereal Arcanist
how_to_get: Ethereal Arcanist can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
flavourtext: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.
strategy: Ethereal Arcanist is best played in combination with Secrets in scenarios where your opponent cannot quickly dispose of him or your Secrets. Try to play multiple Secrets at a time since you can have more than one active Secret up. Depending on the Secrets you have available, try to play the ones that your opponent might not trigger right away. Also try to play a Taunt or maybe some freeze spells in order to protect Ethereal Arcanist long enough to get his effect rolling. On the other hand, if you find yourself up against this card, you can either try to dispose of it if you have the damage available or you can trigger your opponent's Secret and hope that they don't have a replacement. Focusing on Ethereal Arcanist when you don't have the damage available can quickly get out of hand.

name: Explosive Shot
how_to_get: Explosive Shot is a rare card from the Hunter deck earned from a card pack or crafting with Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Deal 5 damage to a minion and 2 damage to adjacent ones.
flavourtext: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot. Then duck.

name: Felguard
how_to_get: Felguard can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Taunt. Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
flavourtext: Yes, he'll fight for you. BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.
strategy: Unlike the Overload ability that appears on some shaman cards, the Battlecry on this minion permanently destroys one of your mana crystals, essentially setting you back one full turn of mana development for the rest of the game. Players will need to decide if this is worth the slightly undercosted minion you receive in exchange. Felguard can be directly compared to Sen'jin Shieldmasta; additional demon-related synergy aside, Felguard is therefore essentially a 4-mana minion for the price of 3. Without substantial card synergy, this makes the Felguard's battlecry a very good disincentive from playing him.

name: Feral Spirit
how_to_get: Feral Spirit can be either made with dust or received from packs.
cardtext: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2)
flavourtext: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.
strategy: Feral Spirit is a card from the Shaman deck that summons 2 2/3 wolves that have taunt. This spell also causes overload of 2, which means that the turn after you play it you are unable to use 2 mana. In essence the card is a 5 mana cost with 3 the first turn and 2 the second. This card allows shamans to set up by getting out 2 taunt cards relatively early. It has its risks because of overload, but in the proper deck it can be of great use.

name: Flare
how_to_get: Flare is obtained through card packs and crafting. Flare can be crafted with 100 Arcane Dust. Flare can be disenchanted for 20 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.
flavourtext: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but its also great for parties!
strategy: Flare is an extremely strong situational card which removes stealth, destroys enemy secrets in play and allows you to draw a card. One of its strongest uses is in countering the very strong and popular hunter secret Explosive Trap. It can also be use preemptively if going for the kill with a large minion to prevent the use of defensive secrets such as Counterspell, Ice Block, Eye for an Eye and Misdirection. While Flare is a situational card it can be used against Rogues to remove stealth and useful against Paladins, Mages, and other Hunters to get rid of their secrets. Against the other classes, while they are not focusing stealth and they don't have any secret cards can still be useful, if they use any of the neutral stealthing minions.

name: Frothing Berserker
cardtext: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
flavourtext: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.
strategy: Frothing Berserker gains +1 attack whenever ANY minion takes damage. This means that whenever you attack your opponents minions or when they attack any of yours, Frothing Berserker will gain +2 attack. Unless one of the minions has zero attack of course. Frothing Berserker is best played in scenarios where there are lots of minions with low attack on either side of the field. Play Frothing Berserker in conjunction with a Taunt card so your opponent will most likely have to buff Frothing Berserker in order to get to him. Also does well in conjunction with Armorsmith so your opponent has to make a choice between giving you armor or buffing Frothing Berserker.

name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
cardtext: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
flavourtext: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.
strategy: Strong when used in combination with multiple low casting cost spells. For instance Gadgetzan Auctioneer synergizes well with rogue combos, giving a lot of card draw in the late game.

name: Headcrack
cardtext: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
flavourtext: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.
strategy: The combo on this card and it's low mana cost makes it a strong end-match card. Two extra damage every turn if used after another card.

name: Holy Fire
how_to_get: Holy Fire can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Deal 5 damage. Restore 5 Health to your hero.
flavourtext: Often followed by Holy Smokes!

name: Holy Wrath
cardtext: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its cost.
flavourtext: C'mon Molten Giant!!
strategy: Holy Wrath should be played in a fairly high mana deck for obvious reasons. Since the cost of this card is a bit higher and the damage is not reliable, it's for most purposes better to pick Hammer of Wrath for card generation. Also, don't have a Wisp in your deck while playing this card; just don't.

name: Imp Master
cardtext: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to this minion and summon a 1/1 Imp.
flavourtext: She would enjoy the job a lot more if she just could get the imps to QUIT BITING HER.
strategy: The mechanics of Imp Master work well when the only damage it takes is from it's own ability, this card is best paired with a card that can Taunt. In a situation where your opponent does not have a lot of minions it can be very easy to overwhelm them. Paired with buffed damage a combo with Imp Master can deal some serious damage to your opponent's hero.

name: Injured Blademaster
how_to_get: Injured Blademaster can be found in card packs or crafted by using 100 Arcane dusts.
cardtext: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to HIMSELF.
flavourtext: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.
strategy: The Injured Blademaster is a fairly cheap and tanky minion. He can be run effectively in a priest deck as the heals can benefit him as soon as he comes out. He also works well in a warrior deck, combining him with Rampage and Battle Rage.

name: Keeper of the Grove
cardtext: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.
flavourtext: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.
strategy: After playing this card you can choose to either do two damage to the target of your choice or to Silence a minion. Silence is an effective solution for a minion which has a strong effect or was buffed by many spells.

name: Kirin Tor Mage
how_to_get: Kirin Tor Mage can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: The next Secret you play this turn costs (0).
flavourtext: The Kirin Tor reside in the floating city of Dalaran. How do you make a Dalaran float? Two scoops of ice cream, one scoop of Dalaran.
strategy: Kirin Tor Mage is best used in a deck that has many secrets in them. Since all mage secrets cost 3 mana, you essentially receive a free 4/3 minion whenever you pair this card with a secret.

name: Knife Juggler
how_to_get: Knife Juggler can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: After you summon a minion, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
flavourtext: Ambitious Knife Jugglers sometimes graduate to Bomb Jugglers. They never last long enough to make it onto a card though.
strategy: This card is great card because of the ability associated with the card. It is a powerful card in any aggro deck because aggro decks are based around placing minions into play. Each time you place a minion into play, it allows you to hit your opponent for 1. You want to buff this card to make it harder to kill in order to have this persistent effect throughout the game.
