Knife Juggler is generally considered a high priority target by enemy players, this can easily be used to your advantage to bait out enemy removal spells if paired with a strong taunting creature. Players sometimes refer to this as a creature with a 'soft taunt'. Aside from having an incredible ability, Knife Juggler is one of the strongest minions that a player can summon while only spending 2 mana and can be very helpful in establishing early board dominance. This card has notable synergy with paladin and shaman decks, as they can summon a minion each turn with their hero powers. It works with warlock decks to a lesser extent, since their hero power is in effect a built-in card draw engine, and is generally recommended for any warlock aggro or murloc deck.

name: Lava Burst
how_to_get: Lava Burst can be found in card packs or created using the crafting system.
cardtext: Deal 5 damage. Overload: (2)
flavourtext: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!
strategy: Lava burst is a staple of any strong Shaman deck, affording high damage for relatively low cost.

name: Lightning Storm
how_to_get: Lightning Storm can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Deal 2-3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)
flavourtext: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.
strategy: Lightning Storm is a cheap, but somewhat random board clear for shamans. Keep in mind that the overload will kick in next turn; miscalculating the next turn can be a huge mistake after yielding an unlucky 2 damage, instead of the hoped-for 3.

name: Lightwarden
cardtext: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
flavourtext: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.
strategy: This card works well with healing based heroes and cards such as Darkscale Healer, Druid of the Claw, Earthen Ring Farseer, Guardian of Kings, Priestess of Elune, and Repair Bot. With these cards, you can heal up your minions while buffing your Lightwarden. This can quickly add up and make Lightwarden a menacing foe for your opponent.

name: Lightwell
cardtext: At the start of your turn, restore 3 Health to a damaged friendly character.
flavourtext: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.
strategy: Lightwell has the potential to be an extremely powerful and valuable card, and priests should take care to protect it. When playing against a Lightwell, it is generally desirable to remove or Silence it as quickly as possible.

name: Mana Addict
how_to_get: This card is obtained through purchasing booster packs in the store or crafted by using 100 Arcane dusts.
cardtext: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.
flavourtext: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.
strategy: Play with low cost buff cards for some good cast based burst damage. Also, using The Coin counts as a spell, and therefore an activation of the ability.

name: Mana Tide Totem
how_to_get: Mana Tide Totem can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: At the end of your turn, draw a card.
flavourtext: It is said that some shaman can say 'Floatin' totem' 10 times, fast.
strategy: Mana tide totem is a really powerful tool to get card advantage, if it lives a few turns. If it's on your side it's worth defending, or if it's against you it could be a high priority target, before things get out of control.

name: Mana Wraith
cardtext: ALL minions cost (1) more.
flavourtext: They come out at night to eat leftover mana crystals. 'Mmmmmm,' they say.
strategy: Mana Wraith requires a lot of deep ingame knowledge and a right deck to be used with greater success. You need to use it right before opponent is expected to play a minion, for example right before opponent's Sen'jin when you have a lot of 1-3 HP minions on turn 4, or to prevent that Deathwing from wiping the board.

name: Mass Dispel
how_to_get: Mass Dispel can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
flavourtext: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.
strategy: Applies the Silence effect on all enemy minions which is useful when your opponent has many minions with powerful effects on the field. Also, as an AoE it can pull your opponent's minions out of Stealth. A well placed Mass Dispel is possible to make all the Shaman's totems useless.

name: Master of Disguise
cardtext: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth.
flavourtext: She's actually a male tauren. People don't call him 'Master of Disguise' for nothing.

name: Master Swordsmith
how_to_get: Rare; it can be obtained through expert booster packs and be used by any class's deck.
cardtext: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Attack.
flavourtext: He's currently trying to craft a 'flail-axe', but all the other swordsmiths say it can't be done.
strategy: Master Swordsmith is a great way to boost your minion's damage. Keep Master Swordsmith alive with Taunt minions. The longer Master Swordsmith is alive, the more damage your minions will receive. Master Swordsmith works the best with many defensive cards.

name: Mind Control Tech
how_to_get: Mind Control Tech can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random.
flavourtext: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.

name: Misdirection
how_to_get: Misdirection can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Secret: When a character attacks your hero, instead he attacks another random character.
flavourtext: Sometimes its as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.
strategy: When this effect says random, it means random. The attack can be directed towards either hero, any minion on the board, or even itself. There is no control or bounds to its target. If triggered along with Explosive Trap, the enemy triggering it will take the Explosive Trap's damage before attacking its new target. If triggered while the enemy hero has a weapon equipped, and if the minion who triggered it is forced to attack the enemy hero, then the minion will take retaliatory damage from the hero's weapon. If you have placed both a Misdirection and a Freezing Trap and an enemy minion attacks your Hero, the minion will return to your opponent's hand without triggering Misdirection.

name: Mortal Strike
how_to_get: Can be obtained from booster packs or created using the crafting system. Create: 100 / Disenchant: 20 / Gold create: 800 / Gold disenchant: 100
cardtext: Deal 4 damage. If your hero has 12 or less Health, deal 6 damage instead.
flavourtext: 'If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike.' - The Warrior Code, Line 6
strategy: This is one of the few abilities a warrior has in his arsenal that can deal significant direct damage to either a minion or opposing champion without having to take damage in return. The 4 damage during the majority of the game is enough to clear most taunt minions, especially when used in combination with Slam, Whirlwind, Heroic Strike or Execute. The 2 point damage bump when health is low, as well as being able to hit any target instead of just minions, make it worth the extra mana cost over similar spells such as Shadow Bolt. Mortal Strike can also be used as a game finisher when you need that last few points of damage to finish off the opposing champion.

name: Murloc Tidecaller
how_to_get: Murloc Tidecaller can be obtained from card packs or by crafting 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Whenever a Murloc is summoned, gain +1 Attack.
flavourtext: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

name: Nourish
how_to_get: Nourish is obtained through card packs and crafting. Nourish can be crafted with 100 Arcane Dust. Nourish can be disenchanted for 20 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
flavourtext: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.
strategy: Most people never choose the 'gain 2 mana crystals' option because it costs 5 mana crystals. But the mana crystals you get can be used in other turns, such as you can see in this little strategy: 'Enemy turn - 1 mana. Your turn - 5 cards in hand, 1 mana crystal. Innervate, Innervate, Nourish, Wild Growth. 1 card in hand left, 0/4 mana. Enemy turn - 2 mana. Your turn - You draw your 6th card and get +1 mana. 2 cards in hand, 5 mana crystals. Nourish, Wild Growth. No cards in hand, 0/8 mana. Enemy turn - 3 mana. Your turn - You draw your 7th card and get +1 mana. 1 card in hand, 9 mana crystals. Summon Alexstrasza.'

name: Perdition's Blade
how_to_get: Perdition's Blade may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead.
flavourtext: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

name: Pint-Sized Summoner
how_to_get: This minion can be obtained through crafting or by opening an expert booster pack. It is available to be used in any class deck.
cardtext: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
flavourtext: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.
strategy: Similar to the Warlock's Summoning Portal, the Pint-Sized Summoner is used to bring minions onto the field at a discounted mana cost. It can be used to bring out an expensive tough monster early or make a cheaper one completely free. Unlike the Portal, this minion has an attack value and can also be used for the simple purpose of causing damage. It also has the added benefit of being usable by any hero's deck. Might be stealthed for prolonged use.

name: Questing Adventurer
cardtext: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.
flavourtext: 'Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?'
strategy: Questing Adventurer is a generic minion, so it can be used by any hero. As a 3 drop he remains dangerous towards the lategame, and if left untouched for a few turns can get out of control. A very strong card to get out early as it can build up to be a huge threat and even force multiple spells to remove it early. Very strong in a rogue deck as they have a large number of very low cost cards, but generally works in any deck. When this card is played, a smart opponent will immediately focus on neutralizing (Silence, Humility) or killing it as quickly as possible. If you intend it to grow into a threat, you will need protective measures such as Divine Shield and other minions who can taunt.

name: Ravenholdt Assassin
how_to_get: Ravenholdt Assassin can be found in card packs or created using the crafting system
cardtext: Stealth
flavourtext: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold. He'll take care of the rest.
strategy: Ravenholdt Assassin can be put on the field without being targetable by creatures due to Stealth, making him safe from creatures until you attack with him. It is wise to leave him in stealth until you are sure he cannot be killed as stealth protects him from spells as well as creatures.

name: Savagery
how_to_get: Savagery can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
flavourtext: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.
strategy: Best used in conjunction with abilities like Bite and Claw to cause large amounts of damage to your opponent's entire board. Very useful if you have lost board position to clear out or severely weaken their minions before wiping them up with your own. Savagery combined with Bite is the best board clearing combo available to a druid.

name: Savannah Highmane
how_to_get: Savannah Highmane can be obtained from booster packs and crafting 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.
flavourtext: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.
strategy: This card is a very effective card to be used in a Hunter/Beast deck, provides ample defence and great potential offence when it dies. The deathrattle summoned beasts count as you summoning the beasts and thus procs your Starving Buzzard's draw power.

name: Secretkeeper
how_to_get: Secretkeeper is obtained through card packs and crafting. Secretkeeper can be crafted with 100 Arcane Dust. Secretkeeper can be disenchanted for 20 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1.
flavourtext: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.
strategy: [Secret Keeper] is a one mana cost card for a 1/2 minion who receives a +1/+1 boost whenever a Secret is played. As there are only three classes that can currently use secrets (Hunter, Mage, and Paladin), this card is extremely situational, and you can probably find a better one mana cost card for your deck. Bear in mind that the cost of secrets differ for each class. This makes Paladin the most viable class for a fast buffed Secret Keeper, if that is what you are aiming for.

name: Shadow Madness
how_to_get: Shadow Madness can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
flavourtext: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.
strategy: Shadow Madness is a very tactical card, capable of being used to great effect. Unlike permanent mind control effects like Mind Control, minions that are affected by this card are not exhausted, but can be used by the priest that same turn. One common tactic is to use the controlled minion to attack another, hopefully destroying both minions. This effectively grants removal for two minions with only one card. One less common tactic is to control a valuable minion, and before the end of your turn play a return card such as Ancient Brewmaster, placing it into your hand. This allows the priest to permanently seize control of the minion, as long as they are happy to spend the mana necessary to summon it. Ideally, use the minion to deal damage before returning it to your hand, as any damage taken by it will be cancelled when it when it leaves the battlefield. Can also be very useful for removing a powerful taunt minion in order to allow your minions to directly attack the enemy hero. As with all mind control effects, any abilities or events that occur while the minion is controlled will treat the controlling player as the minion's owner. This includes deathrattles and other card text effects.

name: Shadowflame
cardtext: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
flavourtext: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

name: SI:7 Agent
how_to_get: SI:7 Agent cant be obtained from booster packs and crafting 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Combo: Deal 2 damage.
flavourtext: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities. Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.
strategy: This is a 3 drop for 3/3 attack, which makes it a cheap minion that if played on turn 2 with as second player would deal 2 early damage with an early 3/3 out.

name: Siphon Soul
how_to_get: Siphon Soul can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Destroy a minion. Restore 3 Health to your hero.
flavourtext: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul. You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.
strategy: Siphon Soul is the warlock's answer to the healthiest or most powerful enemies. Similar to Assassinate for rogues, it is the warlock's simple and certain removal spell. Its added bonus of a 3 heal designs it specifically for warlocks and their tendency to hurt themselves. It also has the versatility of targeting your own minions, useful to trigger deathrattles (eg. Abomination) or if the minion is going to die within the next turn, such as due to Power Overwhelming. There is no downside to this card besides its somewhat hefty 6 mana cost. As a straight up removal effect it bypasses Divine Shields.

name: Spirit Wolf
how_to_get: Two Spirit Wolves are summoned when the Feral Spirit card is played.
cardtext: Taunt
strategy: Spirit wolf is a staple taunt of many decks given its low cost and high health. A good use is to use its taunt to cover vulnerable units in the early-game which require time to ramp up their abilities and combos.

name: Stampeding Kodo
how_to_get: Stampeding Kodo can be found in card packs or created using the crafting system
cardtext: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
flavourtext: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.
strategy: Stampeding Kodo is by far most popular in Hunter decks. Because hunters have many cards that interact with beasts like the Stampeding Kodo it is a great addition to a hunter deck.

name: Starfall
cardtext: Choose One - Deal 5 damage to a minion; or 2 damage to all enemy minions.
flavourtext: Is the sky falling? Yes. Yes it is.
strategy: Starfall is a powerful removal spell. As with several other druid spells, Starfall is a modular spell, meaning you get to choose one of multiple effects when cast. This gives it a lot of versatility when compared to other removal spells. It can be used to damage multiple minions or can be used to deal heavy damage to a single minion.

name: Sunfury Protector
how_to_get: Sunfury Protector may be received either through opening Hearthstone booster packs or crafting using arcane dust received from disenchanting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.
flavourtext: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.
strategy: Gives gives adjacent minions Taunt. This allows you to create defense for high priority cards or yourself if you play Sunfury Protector besides other less important minions.

name: Sunwalker
how_to_get: Obtained through opening booster packs or can be crafted for 100 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Taunt. Divine Shield
flavourtext: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun. It's just a name. Don’t worry!
strategy: This card has both Divine Shield and Taunt which makes it a very good defensive wall that takes extra effort to destroy. And arguably more importantly, it sits in the safe spot between 3 and 5 attack, making it avoid the two most common Priest kill spells. Otherwise compare it to Lord of the Arena.

name: Twilight Drake
how_to_get: Twilight Drake can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
flavourtext: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy. And Tacos.

name: Upgrade!
how_to_get: Can be obtained from booster decks or crafted using the crafting system. Create: 100 / Disenchant: 20 / Gold create: 800 / Gold Disenchant: 100
cardtext: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.
flavourtext: Easily worth 50 DKP.
strategy: Early game, this is an efficient source of damage for warrior decks. Late game however, when combined with cards like Gorehowl, with its incredibly high attack and only 1 durability, it can become a game changer by giving you up to 8 damage to the enemy hero per use for only one mana.

name: Vaporize
how_to_get: Vaporize can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
flavourtext: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card. We may never know the truth.
strategy: It is generally a good idea to play this card when your opponent has a massive monster bearing down on you (such as Deathwing). A good counter strategy is to send in a weak minion in first to burn the trap before you attack with your massive monster.

name: Violet Teacher
how_to_get: Violet Teacher is a rare card, can be opened in packs or crafted by using 100 Arcane dusts.
cardtext: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
flavourtext: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig. And then you get your name on the board.
strategy: This card should be placed in order to set up some defense as you strike and dish out additional damage on your next turn. Each spell you cast summons a common 1/1 Violet Apprentice

name: Void Terror
how_to_get: Void Terror can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Destroy the minions on either side of this minion and gain their Attack and Health.
flavourtext: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.
strategy: Void Terror is a demon minion that is used by the warlock. It has a cost of 3, attack of 3, and 3 HP. It also has the ability Battlecry: Destroy the minions on either side of this Minion and gain their Attack and Health. This card is very useful if you are tight on health or you just simply want to kill the opponent faster. It may be a big sacrifice, but in the end the Void Terror is great addition to any warlock deck. While many new players will discredit the idea of sacrificing your own minions, the effect of this minion cannot be underestimated, as it allows you to combine the total attack and health of smaller minions into one large minion, capable of profitable trades or damage to your opponent. This card also effectively counters 'sweeper' spells that rely on small amounts of damage dealt to multiple minions, such as Blizzard or Hellfire; where you might lose all of your minions to such cards, combining them into a Void Terror allows the Terror to survive and continue to do large amounts of damage. Also this card combos very well with the warlock spell Power Overwhelming. To execute the combination with Power Overwhelming you need to play Power Overwhelming on a minion you intend to have Void Terror consume. After casting Power Overwhelming, attack with the targeted minion (not required for the combo but generally advised). Then finally play Void Terror adjacent to the targeted creature, resulting in a retaining the bonus damage and life that was granted by Power Overwhelming.

name: Wild Pyromancer
how_to_get: Wild Pyromancer can be found in card packs or created using 100 Arcane Dust
cardtext: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
flavourtext: BOOM BABY BOOM! BAD IS GOOD! DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

name: Young Priestess
cardtext: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
flavourtext: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

name: Ancestral Healing
cardtext: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.
flavourtext: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

name: Arcane Explosion
how_to_get: Arcane Explosion x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Arcane Explosion is a reward for raising a mage to level 28 and 30. Arcane Explosion is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.
flavourtext: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions.
strategy: Arcane Explosion is extremely useful for clearing enemy minions from the board, and represents one of the mage's main defensive plays against aggressive decks. While its low damage makes it primarily useful against low-health minions, with spell damage minions the spell can be improved to deal substantial damage to each enemy minion. This spell is ideally saved until it can be used to deal damage to several opponents, or until spell damage can be gained to amplify its effects. With a full board of enemy minions and a couple of spell damage minions on the mage's side, this 2 mana spell can deal more than 20 points of damage in total. When playing against early-game aggro decks, mages may wish to save this for the mid-game, when the mage's opponent may have the chance to put several of their weaker minions into play at once, in an attempt to overwhelm the mage. This includes 'Berserker' warriors, healing-oriented priests, warlocks and murloc decks. As a cheap spell, Arcane Explosion can also be used in combination with other spells, such as using Frostbolt, Fireblast or even a second Arcane Explosion to finish off tougher targets. Arcane Explosion's more explosive equivalent is Flamestrike.

name: Arcane Intellect
how_to_get: Arcane Intellect x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Arcane Intellect is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Draw 2 cards.
flavourtext: Playing this card makes you SMARTER. And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.
strategy: As a 3 mana 2 draw card Arcane Intellect can give the player a massive card advantage. It is the only mage specific card draw mechanic. While 3 mana may be costly early game, Arcane Intellect can easily turn the card advantage around late game. While it isn't the best draw card in the game, it can be used quite effectively in quite a number of decks.

name: Arcane Missiles
how_to_get: Arcane Missiles x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Arcane Missiles is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Deal 3 damage randomly split among enemy characters.
flavourtext: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.
strategy: As with any random effect, this spell's usefulness is significantly determined by chance. Under the right conditions this spell is capable of destroying 3 separate characters (more with spell damage). As a non-targeted effect, this spell is capable of hitting stealthed targets. This makes this a very useful card against targets like Blood Imp.

name: Arcane Shot
how_to_get: Arcane Shot is a free card
cardtext: Deal 2 damage.
flavourtext: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves. The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.
strategy: Arcane shot is a cheap, moderate damage ability often used to harass enemy heroes or finish off enemy minions without risking friendlies.

name: Armor Up!
how_to_get: Armor Up! is the warrior hero power.
cardtext: Hero Power. Gain 2 Armor.
strategy: This hero power grants the user 2 Armor. This can be used frequently to accrue a large pile of Armor. This can be a good way of spending spare mana, effectively countering 2 points of damage per use. Works very well with Shield Slam. By far the most defensive hero power in the game.

name: Assassinate
how_to_get: Assassinate x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Assassinate is a reward for raising a rogue to level 24 and 26. Assassinate is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Destroy an enemy minion.
flavourtext: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!
strategy: Assassinate instantly kills an enemy minion, no matter how durable it is. So it is best to keep it for a high health minion or a minion with important buffs. It is also effective against minions with high damage since it removes the minion while avoiding taking damage.

name: Avatar of the Coin
cardtext: You lost the coin flip, but gained a friend.

name: Backstab
how_to_get: Backstab comes free with the rogue deck.
cardtext: Deal 2 damage to an undamaged minion.
flavourtext: It's funny how often yelling 'Look over there!' gets your opponent to turn around.
strategy: With the low cost backstab is best used as a pre-cursor to a card that has a combo ability. This will allow you to do damage and make a combo with no mana cost. Addtionaly you can power up the damage dealt by backstab with spellpower bonuses.

name: Blessing of Might
cardtext: Give a minion +3 Attack.
flavourtext: As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way. - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.
strategy: This card with the ability to make even the weakest minion being able to hit hard for only 1 mana is one of the reasons it is used in many paladin decks. Using it together with Blessing of Kings and/or Blessed Champion makes it very deadly for heavy hitting combos. Make sure you don't use it on the turn the minion is dropped, instead wait until your minion is ready to attack so you get the element of surprise. To get maximum efficiency, Blessing of Might can be used on the few neutral minions with windfury.

name: Bloodfen Raptor
flavourtext: 'Kill 30 raptors.' - Hemet Nesingwary
strategy: The Bloodfen Raptor is not recommended for non-Hunter decks, as its only advantage over similar 2 drops (like Acidic Swamp Ooze) is him being a Beast (e.g. having synergy with other Beast related cards).

name: Boulderfist Ogre
flavourtext: 'ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST'
strategy: Boulderfist Ogre can be a high dealing damage card, who can take a punch. However the card doesn't have any special abilities, so it can just be played if you just need a minion.

name: Charge
how_to_get: Charge x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Charge is a reward for raising a warrior to level 24. Charge is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Give a friendly minion Charge.
flavourtext: 'Guys! Guys! Slow down!' - some kind of non-warrior minion
strategy: Charge is an excellent card to have. The ability to play a large minion and immediately attack with it late game can be game changing, or it could be used early/mid game to help clear your opponents side of the board. Either way, at 0 mana, it isn't going to be costing you much. Charge also combos well with Mana Addict, Questing Adventurer, or any minion with Windfury. Not only does it boost the capability of these minions at no additional cost but it allows you to get some major hits in before your opponent has a chance to react and take them out. For example, you can play a 1 damage 3 health Mana Addict for 2 mana, Charge for free making it a 3/3, Inner Rage for free making it a 7/2, then Rampage for 2 mana making it a 12/4 monster that can swing immediately and your opponent is powerless to stop it, all for 4 mana.

name: Claw
how_to_get: Claw comes free with the druid deck.
cardtext: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn and 2 Armor.
flavourtext: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.
strategy: Claw may target minions or heroes. Claw is best used to destroy a pesky enemy minion. The armor it provides will prevent you from taking retaliation damage from the minion you target. Used in conjunction with the druid power you are able to deal 3 damage and save yourself from 3 damage. Alternatively, you can use Bite to reach across the battlefield and deal direct damage to the opposing hero.

name: Dagger Mastery
cardtext: Hero Power - Equip a 1/2 Dagger.
strategy: The rogue's hero power may seem weak at first glance, but is key to the tactical strengths of the rogue. This allows a rogue to tackle and potentially destroy a low-health minion each turn. This can allow the rogue to directly and very affordably remove low-level minions from the board during the early game, while still having enough mana to summon minions of their own. Unlike the druid's Shapeshift power, it only needs to be used once to gain two uses. The main downside with this power is the same as with any other weapon - attacking a minion using it will cause that minion to deal its damage to the rogue. This is a critical tactical choice for rogues. This power can allow them to maintain strong board control through the early game, but that control comes at the price of substantial self-inflicted damage. The rogue may choose to take the damage themselves in order to protect their minions, allowing them to build an imposing army; but if their health dips too low, or their army is suddenly removed with a well-timed Arcane Explosion, they may leave themselves open to a swift defeat. This is the only hero power that allows a hero to equip a weapon on demand. This weapon, while fairly weak, can be improved by effects such as Deadly Poison and Spiteful Smith's enrage to offer something far more powerful, and can be used with cards such as Southsea Deckhand and Bloodsail Raider. Unlike the druid's Shapeshift power, this power's effects do not expire at the end of the turn. This means that a rogue can use this power to equip a knife in advance, ready to be used whenever it is needed. This makes this power an excellent dump for spare mana.

name: Deadly Poison
how_to_get: Deadly Poison is a standard card, available for use in all Rogue decks.
cardtext: Give your weapon +2 Attack.
flavourtext: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells. Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison? Poison Elemental? Nobody wants that.
strategy: Deadly Poison has synergy with Bloodsail Raider, Dread Corsair, and the Rogue Blade Flurry spell, all three of which benefit from greater weapon attack.

name: Drain Life
how_to_get: Free
cardtext: Deal 2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.
flavourtext: 'I've just sucked one year of your life away.'
strategy: This spell is affected by additional spellpower, increasing each portion of the spell by 1 for each spellpower the player has. The healing portion will always heal the full amount as long as the player's health is at 28 or lower, even if the damage portion didn't do the full amount of damage, making this card handy in a pinch.

name: Execute
cardtext: Destroy a damaged enemy minion.
flavourtext: It's okay, he deserved it.
strategy: Inner Rage combos nicely with this, allowing you to instantly kill any minion for one mana regardless of shielding or other defenses.

name: Fiery War Axe
how_to_get: Fiery War Axe can be obtained by leveling the Warrior class.
flavourtext: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.
strategy: The Fiery War Axe is a good source of early damage for Warrior decks; it can be used as an efficient source of damage against heroes being 6 damage for only 2 mana over 2 turns, or it can be used to easily clear early minions without much backlash damage with Armor Up!

name: Fireball
how_to_get: Fireball x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Fireball is a reward for raising a mage to level 36 and 38. Fireball is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Deal 6 damage.
flavourtext: This spell is useful for burning things. If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.
strategy: Mages have a number of spells in their arsenal for dealing damage, such as Arcane Explosion, Frostbolt, Cone of Cold, and of course, Fireball. A mage must carefully consider which spells to include in their deck. While other spells do damage to more than one minion, or have secondary effects such as Freezing, or have restrictions, such as Ice Lance, Fireball has no secondary costs or effects, making it one of the most consistent spells in your arsenal. A deck including Fireball is very unlikely to include two copies of it and no copies of any other spell. For this reason, it's important to see what spells we want to pair Fireball with. Fireball, being a single-target spell, shares a similar spot in the deck to Pyroblast, Frostbolt and sometimes Ice Lance. Pyroblast is very expensive, so it's unlikely to want to deal with the same minions as you would with Fireball. Frostbolt deals 2 less damage and freezes for 1 less mana - which leaves Fireball as the better choice, unless you think that 6 damage is 'Overkill', or you are using spell damage minions to boost the power of Frostbolt to higher damage. Fireball does a large amount of damage to a single creature, which leaves us vulnerable as a mage to a large number of smaller creatures. A deck that includes Fireball should probably include some number of cards that help with smaller minions, such as Arcane Explosion, Blizzard, or Flamestrike. Lastly, Fireball can target your opponent. If you want to go a direct-damage route, it can be paired with Pyroblast for maximum damage. If this is the case, you will probably want to pair the card with Sorcerer's Apprentice, Kobold Geomancer, Dalaran Mage and other Minions that assist in dealing damage.

name: Fireblast
cardtext: Hero Power - Deal 1 damage.
strategy: While at first glance Fireblast may seem weak compared to some of the other Hero Powers, it in fact possesses many unique advantages. Its ability to directly target minions or heroes makes it extremely useful for picking off vulnerable yet valuable targets, hidden behind a wall of Taunts. It can also be used to conveniently destroy damaged yet powerful minions, or obstructive enemies such as Mirror Images, preventing damage next round or opening the way for your own minions to attack their preferred targets. Since Fireblast deals only a single point of damage, some strategy is needed to ensure that that point is applied where it is most effective. Fireblast can also be used as an effective way to enrage your own minions for only 1 damage. For example, use Fireblast on your Gurubashi Berserker to make it go from a 2/7 to a 5/6. When the mage is left with at least 2 mana to spare at the end of the round, Fireblast can be a useful mana dump, even if all it accomplishes is dealing 1 damage to the opponent hero, or reducing a minion's health by 1.

name: Frost Shock

flavourtext: FROST SHOCK!

cardtext: Deal 3 damage. Draw a card.

name: Hand of Protection
how_to_get: Hand of Protection is a free card from the Paladin deck.
cardtext: Give a minion Divine Shield.
flavourtext: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.
strategy: Hand of Protection is a relatively cheap way to save a minion from potential death. Divine Shield can be placed on any minion and shields from one attack. This card can be used even if a minion has lost their own Divine Shield, and can be played in preparation for a Blood Knight.

name: Healing Totem
cardtext: At the end of your turn, restore 1 Health to all friendly minions.
strategy: Healing Totem is very useful when used in conjunction with several other minions. It works especially well with high-health minions, since these have more room to take damage without being destroyed entirely. Since the Totem restores health at the end of your turn. Since this takes places before your opponent has the chance to act, its healing can be taken into account when planning attacks.

name: Healing Touch
cardtext: Restore 8 Health.
flavourtext: 8 Health, no waiting.

name: Hellfire
how_to_get: Hellfire x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Hellfire is a reward for raising a warlock to level 24 and 26. Hellfire is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Deal 3 damage to ALL characters.
flavourtext: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.
strategy: Hellfire is one of the strongest board wipes in the game but its use must be carefully weighed. It's important to note that if a minion benefits from an ongoing effect granted by another minion that will be killed by Hellfire then it too will die, as the buff is contingent upon the buffer remaining alive. An example is a 2/3 minion buffed to 3/4 by a card such as Murloc Warleader, which only has 3/3. Casting Hellfire will kill both the Murloc Warleader and the 3/4 buffed minion. It is also important to remember that Hellfire not only damages all characters on the field, but also yourself and your opponent directly.

name: Heroic Strike
how_to_get: The regular version is available automatically in the standard Warrior deck. The Golden version is unlocked by leveling up the Warrior hero. There can be 2 of this card in your deck.
cardtext: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.
flavourtext: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.
strategy: This card can be used multiple times in a turn, and stacks. Bursting down the enemy is very possible.

name: Hex
cardtext: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
flavourtext: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?
strategy: This is a great card for easily and efficiently removing large minions from the field. It can be tempting to use early in the game due to the low mana cost, but is often better saved for later. Saving for later use can be like 'breakpoint' for a player in dangerous situation and help a lot. Do not forget that the frog has Taunt however, so it will still need to be destroyed before you can attack other minions or the player.

name: Holy Light
cardtext: Restore 6 Health
flavourtext: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.
strategy: Holy Light is a basic but useful card without much strategy involved; either heal yourself or a minion for a large amount and a small mana cost.

name: Holy Smite
cardtext: Deal 2 damage.
flavourtext: It doesn't matter how pious you are. Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

name: Houndmaster
cardtext: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +2/+2 and Taunt.
flavourtext: 'Who let the dogs out?' he asks. It's rhetorical.
strategy: Add this card to a deck heavy in beasts. Play this card when you have a lot of beasts minions to gain the full effect of his Battlecry. A very potent combination of Taunt and +2/2 (attack/health). This will greatly boost your defense as well as offense, changing any beast into a shield to your life points. Your opponent must deal with these taunt beasts or use Silence on each one.

name: Innervate
cardtext: Innervate x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Innervate is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
flavourtext: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling 'Innervate me!!' at them.
strategy: Innervate grants the player 2 extra mana crystals on the turn that it's used. While it is unable to increase your mana crystal pool above 10, it can be used after spending crystals to effectively give you 12 crystals for that turn.

name: Lesser Heal
cardtext: Hero Power - Restore 2 Health.

name: Life Tap
cardtext: Hero Power - Draw a card and take 2 damage.

name: Light's Justice
how_to_get: Light's Justice can be obtained by all players; either gained by completing the tutorial or gained by playing practice games as you earn more heroes. It can only be used in decks with the Paladin hero.
flavourtext: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.
strategy: Allowing your hero to do 1 damage numerous times can be used to destroy token, remove divine shields from the minions, or simply chip away at the enemy's life.

name: Magma Rager
how_to_get: Magma Rager is automatically included in all players' collections.
flavourtext: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.
strategy: It is a high damage low health card, this means it would work with cards that either have taunt, like Mogu'shan Warden, Sen'jin Shieldmasta or Shieldbearer, or cards that can boost its health stats, like Blood Imp or Temple Enforcer. Alternately, granting it Charge will allow it to get off at least one attack. Due to the fact that it becomes an immediate priority for a smart opponent, it can also have value in forcing the use of a more-expensive nullifying ability such as Polymorph or the trading of another high-damage minion.

name: Mark of the Wild
cardtext: Give a minion Taunt and +2/+2. (+2 Attack/+2 Health)
flavourtext: Not to be confused with Jim of the Wild.
strategy: While any minion can benefit from hitting harder and being harder to kill, a note should be made for the Emperor Cobra. Its special ability lets it instantly kill anything it damages. Combined with Taunt, this can be very strong.

name: Mind Blast
how_to_get: Mind Blast is a basic Priest spell and is obtained by leveling that hero type.
cardtext: Deal 5 damage to the enemy hero.
flavourtext: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.
strategy: Mind Blast is a Priest's direct damage spell. While it may seem amazingly cheap for such a large amount of damage, remember that it is locked onto the enemy hero. Unlike Fireball there is no versatility to this card. It is still quite useful and benefits from spell power boosting cards, but it does have the drawback of limited target.

name: Multi-Shot
cardtext: Deal 3 damage to two random enemy minions.
flavourtext: You see, it's all about throughput.

name: Murloc Raider
how_to_get: Murloc Raider is an free card earned from the basic card pack.
flavourtext: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!
strategy: Murloc Raiders are a cheap and solid murloc minion that is an easy addition to any murloc deck.

name: Nightblade
how_to_get: Nightblade is provided in your initial deck in the tutorial.
cardtext: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.
flavourtext: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.
strategy: Use in conjunction with Ancient Brewmaster or Youthful Brewmaster to activate her Battlecry more than once. For maximum effectiveness play Nightblade, attack without destroying the card, summon a Brewmaster to return Nightblade to your hand and play again for full heath.

name: Northshire Cleric
how_to_get: The Northshire Cleric is a starting card of the priest.
cardtext: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
flavourtext: They help the downtrodden and distressed. Also they sell cookies.
strategy: The Northshire Cleric's ability provides you a constant amount of cards if you can get her behind a tank and heal him every turn. Holy Nova and Darkscale Healer are great additions to this card since they heal every minion you have on the battlefield and every heal will give you a card. If you can get 2 Northshire Cleric on the battlefield at the same time, the effect will stack and you will get 2 cards per heal.

name: Novice Engineer
how_to_get: Novice Engineer x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Novice Engineer is a reward for raising a druid or mage to level 59. Novice Engineer is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Battlecry: Draw a card.
flavourtext: 'Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens.' - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.
strategy: Can be cast a second time for free using Shadowstep, allowing you to draw a second card. This can be useful in combination with cards like Questing Adventurer or Edwin VanCleef. This is commonly selected for decks mainly on the strength of its battlecry. Since playing this card allows you to immediately draw another, this can be considered almost a bonus card in your hand. This feature can be useful for a strong start to the game, or for any player who frequently finds themselves running out of cards.

name: Oasis Snapjaw
how_to_get: Oasis Snapjaw can be obtained by leveling your heroes.
flavourtext: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.
strategy: Oasis Snapjaw has a high health for its cost. Thus, it has synergy with cards that give Taunt like Ancestral Spirit, Mark of the Wild, Fade, Defender of Argus or Sunfury Protector. It can be used offensively together with Crazed Alchemist. It also works well in combination with Divine Spirit and Inner Fire, provided you are playing a Priest Deck.

name: Polymorph
how_to_get: Polymorph x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Polymorph is a reward for raising a mage to level 47 and 48. Polymorph is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Transform a minion into a 1/1 Sheep.
flavourtext: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.
strategy: Polymorph is a deceptively strong spell, considering the mage hero power allows the player to deal 1 damage to any target once per turn. This essentially allows a mage to destroy any minion in play if they have a Polymorph spell and 6 mana to spare. Unlike Hex, Polymorph gives the transformed minion 1 attack allowing your opponent to use it offensively. Polymorph synergises well with 'control' decks.

name: Power Word: Shield
cardtext: Give a minion +2 Health. Draw a card.
flavourtext: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.
strategy: One of the priest's many Health-boosting effects, Power Word: Shield can be very useful for protecting valuable minions, and can be particularly handy for use with Lightspawn. Extra health granted by Power Word: Shield can be doubled by a subsequent case of Divine Spirit. Add Inner Fire and you potentially have game-breaking monster of a minion.

name: Raid Leader
how_to_get: Raid Leader is free.
cardtext: Your other minions have +1 Attack.
flavourtext: 'That's a 50 DKP minus!'
strategy: Play Raid Leader in conjunction with other minions. Raid Leader is great in decks that rely on many small minions. To get maximum benefit from this card, play with card with many small minions. With many small minions Raid Leader will be adding +1 attack to each minion, netting you a larger amount of added damage than with a larger, higher mana cost minions which where Raid Leader would only provide a a single +1 attack.

name: Reckless Rocketeer
how_to_get: This card is unlocked in the Tutorial.
cardtext: Charge
flavourtext: One Insane Rocketeer. One Rocket full of Explosives. Infinite Fun.
strategy: The Reckless Rocketeer is an excellent card to play mid to late game to deal quick damage to the enemy hero or to heavily wound an enemy's monster, such as the Core Hound. With it's 2 health, it'll only get in a hit or two before it goes down, so make them count!

name: Reinforce
cardtext: Hero Power - Summon a 1/1 Silver Hand Recruit.
strategy: This ability effectively provides paladins with an endless supply of 1/1 Recruits. This can offer paladins additional advantage from effects that buff the stats of multiple minions, such as Raid Leader and Stormwind Champion.

name: River Crocolisk
how_to_get: This minion can be obtained through crafting or by opening an expert booster pack. It is available to be used in any class deck.
flavourtext: Edward 'Lefty' Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.
strategy: This is a basic simple beast that can be enhanced by the numerous Hunter cards that revolve around beasts. Other class decks can also simply use it during the beginning of the Hearthstone career when more versatile minions with effects aren't available.

name: Rockbiter Weapon
how_to_get: Rockbiter Weapon is a free shaman card.
cardtext: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
flavourtext: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.
strategy: Rockbiter weapon can be used to buff a creatures damage with 3, but for the maximum efficiency it's best used on a windfury creature.

name: Sap
how_to_get: Sap comes free with the rogue deck.
cardtext: Return an enemy minion to its owner's hand.
flavourtext: Rogues love sappy movies.
strategy: Sap is best used after the opponent has spent several turns 'buffing' up a character or simply to get a high damage threat out of the game for one turn. Sap can be used offensively or defensively, you can sap a taunt card and attack or you can sap one of their offensive threats to give you a brief reprieve. Later in the match it can be useful to return expensive minions back to the player's hand--forcing them to spend the mana a second time. As a result of the low cost it is also a good card to use to set up combo effects. Note that sapping a token will not remove it permantly like in other TCGs, but will infact go to their hand as a card to play!

name: Searing Totem
strategy: Searing totem can be useful for poking down weak minions or strong injured minions for no card loss. This outcome of Totemic Call is very similar to the paladin hero power Reinforce.

name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
how_to_get: Sen'jin Shieldmasta x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Sen'jin Shieldmasta is a reward for raising a rogue or warrior to level 59. Sen'jin Shieldmasta is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Taunt
flavourtext: Sen'jin Villiage is nice, if you like trolls and dust.
strategy: Sen'jin Shieldmasta is a good Taunt minion. This is because the card is equally suited to all decks, and does not require any specific build (like Dread Corsair) or board state (like Abomination). The card is of average stats suited to any stage of play, but can have an advantage towards the onset of play. It is a strong taunt minion that can be included in any deck.

name: Shadow Bolt
cardtext: Deal 4 damage to a minion.
flavourtext: It’s a Bolt. Its made out of Shadow. What more do you need to know!
strategy: Shadow bolt is only useable against minions, but it can deal with most of the midgame creatures thanks to its fairly high damage.

name: Shadow Word: Pain
cardtext: Destroy a minion with 3 or less Attack.
flavourtext: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: 'Shadow Word: Annoy'.

name: Shapeshift
cardtext: Hero Power - +1 Attack this turn. +1 Armor.

name: Sinister Strike
how_to_get: Sinister Strike is a free card.
cardtext: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.
flavourtext: There's something about this strike that just feels off. Sinister, even.

name: Steady Shot
cardtext: Hero Power. Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

name: Stoneclaw Totem
how_to_get: Stoneclaw Totem is a shaman minion summoned by the shaman hero power Totemic Call. It is uncollectible cannot be obtained directly.
cardtext: Taunt
strategy: The Stoneclaw Totem is a useful taunt minion. While it cannot attack, its 2 health provides good protection against weak attackers, and wastes a valuable round for stronger minions.

name: Stonetusk Boar
how_to_get: Stonetusk Boar is provided in the tutorial.
cardtext: Charge
flavourtext: This card is boaring.
strategy: Make use of his Charge ability to deal damage to the opponent's hero or minion. The card itself is not very good, but with its ability, it becomes an instant extra 1 damage for 1 mana. A great way to use this card is finish an enemy minion or deal some damage to the enemy hero. Works great in conjection with other cards such as Timber Wolf, Darkspear Hunter, Scavenging Hyena, and Starving Buzzard.

name: Succubus
how_to_get: Succubus x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Succubus is a reward for raising a warlock to level 40 and 42. Succubus is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Battlecry: Discard a random card.
flavourtext: Warlocks have it pretty good.
strategy: The Succubus sacrifices card efficiency for a lower mana cost, so she is often played in aggressive decks that focus on winning the game early. One could also choose to hold off from playing the Succubus until she is the only card in hand to avoid the discard entirely.

name: Timber Wolf
how_to_get: Timber Wolf is in the basic hunter deck. This card can also be obtained by reaching level 22 as a hunter.
cardtext: Your other Beasts have +1 Attack.
flavourtext: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.
strategy: Timber Wolf is a strong 1 mana card that can be used early in the game to make your other beasts more powerful. Timber Wolf can be used by in conjunction with other beasts to make a hunter deck more powerful.

name: Totemic Call
how_to_get: Totemic Call is the shaman hero power.
cardtext: Hero Power. Summon a random Totem.

name: Tracking
cardtext: Look at the top three cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the others.
flavourtext: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put in their deck!

name: Voidwalker
how_to_get: Voidwalker x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Voidwalker is a reward for raising a warlock to level 36 and 38. Voidwalker is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Taunt
flavourtext: No relation to 'The Voidsteppers', the popular Void-based dance troop.
strategy: The Voidwalker is a reasonably tough taunt minion with a very low cost making it a great front line tank for a warlock deck. Not only is it one of the few demons with no back-firing battlecry, it is significantly better than the comparable Goldshire Footman and Shieldbearer while retaining the same low cost. Very good to use with Sense Demons.

name: Voodoo Doctor
cardtext: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health.
flavourtext: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

name: Warsong Commander
how_to_get: Comes in the Garrosh Hellscream deck.
cardtext: Your other minions have Charge.
flavourtext: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.
strategy: Use Warsong Commander in conjunction with hard hitting cards with high mana cost. This allows you to deal massive damage right off the bat. The opponent has no time to react or defend against your high damage Charge attack. You can also use this with low cost minions to deal many instances of small damage to your opponent's hero or minions.

name: Wicked Knife
how_to_get: Wicked Knife is a rogue weapon, equipped through the rogue hero power Dagger Mastery. It is not obtainable directly.
strategy: The rogue hero power is particularly strong in maintaining board control. Particularly in arena you can often 'trade' your own health early in the game to kill enemy minions in order to establish control and force them to waste valuable removal early on. This also keeps your minions alive longer allowing them to attack multiple turns which creates value. However, be careful not to take yourself too low attacking minions or you can tip the advantage into a disadvantage very quickly.

name: Wild Growth
how_to_get: Wild Growth x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Wild Growth is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Gain an empty Mana Crystal.
flavourtext: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!
strategy: The mana crystal you gain is permanent. Effects like Wild Growth are often referred to as a 'mana ramp', as they allow you to quickly ramp up to higher costing-cost cards. Wild growth has a secondary function when a player reaches their mana crystal maximum. If cast when the player has 10 mana crystals, it will place the Excess Mana card in their hand. They can use this to draw a card for free. This means that Wild Growth remains useful even later in the game, when you already have maximum mana.

name: Windfury
how_to_get: Windfury x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Windfury is a reward for raising a shaman to level 24. Windfury is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Give a minion Windfury.
flavourtext: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.
strategy: Especially effective when applied to minions with high Attack, and for dealing damage to heroes or minions with 0 Attack.

name: Wolfrider
cardtext: Charge
flavourtext: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.
strategy: This card works well on it own, but can excel in a Warlock Deck when combined with Power Overwhelming.

name: Wrath of Air Totem
how_to_get: Wrath of Air Totem is a shaman minion summoned by the shaman hero power Totemic Call. It is uncollectible and cannot be obtained directly.
cardtext: Spell Damage +1
strategy: Wrath of Air Totem has good synergy with shaman Area of Effect abilities such as Forked Lightning and Lightning Storm. Be aware that its Spell Damage bonus may cause it to instantly become the focus of your opponent's attacks. While players with damaging spell cards may wish to protect it from their opponents' attacks with a taunt, the Totem can itself be useful as a taunt, attracting attacks from opponents fearing an area of effect ability on your next turn. Players not focusing on spell attacks may therefore wish to leave it unprotected, wasting their opponent's efforts.

name: Abusive Sergeant
how_to_get: Abusive Sergeant can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack this turn.
flavourtext: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!
strategy: Abusive Sergeant's Battlecry effect only lasts one turn, therefore it would be wise to apply the +2 attack bonus to a creature who can do the maximum amount of damage during that turn while trying to minimize loss in short term and long term scenarios.

name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
how_to_get: Acidic Swamp Ooze x 2 are automatically included in all players' collections. Golden Acidic Swamp Ooze is a reward for raising a rogue to level 57. Acidic Swamp Ooze is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
cardtext: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon.
flavourtext: Oozes love Flamenco. Don't ask.
strategy: Acidic Swamp Ooze's attack and health alone make it a good, cheap minion. Its additional ability to act as weapon removal makes it even more effective against decks featuring weapons. Warriors, rogues, paladins are the main weapon classes, but shamans and hunters can also use weapons. Warlocks who have been replaced by Lord Jaraxxus also use the Blood Fury weapon, and Acidic Swamp Ooze can be very effective against this. It is recommended to hold onto this card when you're facing weapon-oriented heroes, such as rogues, warriors and paladins, unless you're absolutely sure they don't use weapons in their decks, or you believe they've already used them all.
lore: Oozes are living blobs of slime that consume all that they touch. Oozes inhabit many places in the world of Azeroth, and are usually mindless. They are also blind. Some oozes have the ability to deal acid damage to objects. Oozes eat and breathe but do not sleep.

name: Acolyte of Pain
how_to_get: Acolyte of Pain is obtained through card packs and crafting. Acolyte of Pain can be crafted with 40 Arcane Dust. Acolyte of Pain can be disenchanted for 5 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.
flavourtext: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.
strategy: Acolyte of Pain is a minion with a draw mechanic. Removal cards that deal damage work in favor of it. Other types of removals make this card ineffective. Acolyte of Pain will still trigger the draw card mechanic if killed outright. Acolyte of Pain's Draw mechanic can be activated by the owner's Mage ability Fire blast. Acolyte of Pain works very well in the mage deck because it is ideal for him to take 1 damage at a time to maximize drawing potential. The mage class spell works very well for this.
lore: Acolytes are novice priests-in-training and are usually spellcasters. Many are human or undead members of the Scourge's Cult of the Damned or part of the Forsaken. These acolytes are most notably warlocks or priests. Some use dark magic to summon or unsummon buildings in order to regain some of its resources back. As part of the Scourge, Acolytes are loyal to the Lich King. If they are part of the Forsaken, they are loyal to Sylvanas.

name: Amani Berserker
how_to_get: Amani Berserker is obtained through card packs and crafting. Amani Berserker can be crafted with 40 Arcane Dust. Amani Berserker can be disenchanted for 5 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Enrage: +3 Attack
flavourtext: If an Amani berserker asks 'Joo lookin' at me?!', the correct response is 'Nah, mon'.
strategy: Amani Berserker's enrage ability is only triggered after damage is dealt. This means that if a minion attacks Amani Berserker and triggers enrage, the minion will only take the 2 damage from Amani Berserker's base attack stat. The +3 attack from enrage stays on Amani Berserker only after the initial trigger has passed, and does not come into play while the trigger is being set off. The Amani Berserker can be combined with the Cruel Taskmaster to great effect. The Taskmaster's Battlecry will deal 1 damage to the Amani Berserker, which will give it +2 attack as well as becoming Enraged for +3 attack. The Amani Berserker ends up being a 7/2 for 2 mana.
lore: The Amani tribe is the remnant of the once great Amani Empire. The famous Warlord Zul'jin was the leader of the tribe for a time.

name: Ancient Brewmaster
how_to_get: Ancient Brewmaster is obtained through card packs and crafting. Ancient Brewmaster can be crafted with 40 Arcane Dust. Ancient Brewmaster can be disenchanted for 5 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
flavourtext: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak. But apparently that's a compliment.
strategy: Use in conjunction with any card with a Battlecry that deals damage, such as Nightblade, to make use of the Battlecry once more. Play the card with a damaging Battlecry, play Ancient Brewmaster, and play the card with a damaging Battlecry once more. For maximum effectiveness do this over more than 1 turn, attacking with the minion before playing Ancient Brewmaster. This is allow your minion to effectively heal back to full health. The Battlecry effect cannot target the Brewmaster itself, so the Brewmaster can be played when no other friendly minions are on the field without bouncing itself.
lore: Hailing from the secretive Pandaren Empire, the mighty brewmasters travel the world in search of exotic ales and the finest brewed spirits. These affable warriors rarely seek out danger or trouble, preferring instead to spend their time concocting new and tasty beverages for any brave enough to imbibe them. However, if attacked, the laughing brewmasters bring all of their pandaren agility and ferocity to bear! They even bring their beer to war! They are peerless warriors and world class drinkers all in one! A rare few pandaren walk outside of their culture's normal ways. Brewmasters are those pandaren given to a fondness for drink. Rather than them being relegated to some outcast place in society, however, pandaren highly regard those who show such a propensity. These pandaren, like all their kind, master a craft: theirs is the creation of ales, wines and other spirits. A rare few pandaren walk outside of their culture's normal ways. Brewmasters are those pandaren given to a fondness for drink. Rather than them being relegated to some outcast place in society, however, pandaren highly regard those who show such a propensity. These pandaren, like all their kind, master a craft: theirs is the creation of ales, wines and other spirits. The brewmasters learn their strange, drunken wardance from these spirits. Brewmasters are the only pandaren who are exempt from the strictures regarding the ability to create and destroy — in all things, the brewmasters are too busy listening to the spirits that swirl about within their heads to care what their peers think. A warrior Hero, the brewmasters of Pandaria have emerged from the bamboo forests of their ancestors to bring their unique fighting style (and robust ales) to the highest bidder.

name: Animal Companion
how_to_get: Animal Companion is obtained while leveling up your hunter.
cardtext: Summon a random Beast Companion.
flavourtext: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer! Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.
strategy: Animal Companion randomly summons Misha, Leokk or Huffer. Although you cannot choose which minion will be summoned, all these three minions are very cost effective. This spell can be used to obtain early board presence and apply pressure to your opponent, forcing him to deal with these early threats. Since these minions are all beasts, they also synergize with the various hunter cards that benefit from having beasts in your deck, such as Scavenging Hyena or Starving Buzzard.
lore: Misha, Leokk and Huffer are all companions of Rexxar.

name: Arathi Weaponsmith
how_to_get: Arathi Weaponsmith is obtained through card packs and crafting. Arathi Weaponsmith can be crafted with 40 Arcane Dust. Arathi Weaponsmith can be disenchanted for 5 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2 weapon.
flavourtext: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!
strategy: Be aware that you are not able to equip more than one weapon at a time. This means that if you already have a weapon equipped when you play Arathi Weaponsmith, the Battlecry effect will be wasted. To clarify, the Battlecry weapon will override any weapon that you have currently equipped.

name: Arcanite Reaper
how_to_get: Arcanite Reaper x 2 are a reward for raising a warrior to level 10. Golden Arcanite Reaper is a reward for raising a warrior to level 48. Arcanite Reaper is soulbound and cannot be crafted or disenchanted.
flavourtext: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.
lore: The weapon remains something of an endearing symbol for veteran warriors since, due to weapon mechanics at the time, the axe's incredible attack speed made attacks such as Mortal Strike incredibly powerful. This led to the warrior class becoming, at level 60, much more adept at PvP. This is something that many warriors had been hoping for since release and the 'awesome changes' in the beta and reversed the feeling by many that warriors had been left at the bottom of the PvP food chain. Soon after the Arcanite Reaper's popularization, many servers' low warrior-population reportedly surged. Before Windfury was nerfed and two handed weapon mechanics rebalanced, shamans were occasionally able to 'one-shot' equal level players with inferior gear by utilizing the Arcanite Reaper and Windfury Weapon proc. Arcanite reaper gained additional fame from the machinima movie, 'Zinwrath: The Movie', where the famous saying 'ARCANITE REAPER HOOOOOOOOOOO' originated, and gained further recognition from the machinima movie 'Illegal Danish: Super Snacks'. Also the Arcanite Reaper is the favored weapon by the warlock minion Felguard.

name: Archmage
how_to_get: Archmage is obtained through card packs and crafting. Archmage can be crafted with 40 Arcane Dust. Archmage can be disenchanted for 5 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Spell Damage +1
flavourtext: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.
strategy: Archmage is quite expensive at a 6 mana cost for a 4/7 minion that gives 1 spell power. If spell power is your goal, other cards such as Dalaran Mage, Azure Drake, or Ogre Magi are much more mana efficient. The 7 health may be useful at killing weaker minion, but without taunt, it may not be too useful.
lore: Archmagi are a type of powerful caster that represent the pinnacle of magical power. Most archmagi hail from the magical kingdom of Dalaran but can be found among other groups as well. Weaving their intricate enchantments, these magi defend themselves and their allies with all the magical powers they have accumulated through their broad and intense studies. Archmagi realize the benefits, not only of a powerful and attuned mind, but a strengthened and prepared body as well. Mounted atop their trusty steeds, the archmagi brandish magical blades and ancient staves that serve to enhance their abilities and channel their fierce energies in battle. Though they can appear gruff and slightly aloof, these experienced wizards are a heartening sight upon any battlefield where the fate of all hangs in the balance. One can attain the title of Archmagi through the study of any arcane school of magic, so long as they have demonstrated a sufficient knowledge level of arcanum and spellcrafting. They must have the ability to cast commonly known arcane spells with flawless execution, in addition to spells from at least five other schools of magic, at varying levels of proficiency. They must also focus primarily on at least two schools of magic, becoming experts. Archmagi of the Kirin Tor forbid warlocks and necromancers from their ranks.

name: Argent Protector
cardtext: Charge, Divine Shield.
flavourtext: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.
strategy: This is one of two 6 Mana Minions with Charge you can choose from. The other one being the Reckless Rocketeer. This leaves you with the choice between 1 more Attack or Divine Shield and one more Health. In most cases you should opt for the Argent Commander since he basically gives you a free Attack into anything, regardless of its damage potential, and lets you deal quickly with, for example, high-damage Taunt Creatures.
lore: The Argent Crusade is an order of holy warriors formed from the union of the Reformed Order of the Silver Hand and the Argent Dawn. Led by the paladin Tirion Fordring, the Argent Crusade was a major contributor to the successful campaign in Northrend that toppled the Lich King. According to the quest Tirion's Help, Tirion Fordring handpicked every member in the Argent Crusade in order to avoid infiltration by the Cult of the Damned. This was presumably to prevent a repeat of the Inigo Montoy incident, which resulted in Naxxramas returning to Northrend and Kel'Thuzad regaining corporeal form. It should be noted that, despite the new Tabard the Argent Crusade uses, several of their members can be found using the old tabard of the Argent Dawn - this is referring to members of the Argent Crusade faction in Northrend, not the Argent Dawn members who are found in Eastern Kingdoms/Kalimdor. Those who wear the old tabard range from the common infantry to the commanders and senior members of the Crusade. This may mean that the two tabards are interchangable in the Crusade, and the old Argent Dawn tabard may still be in production as part of uniform for the members of the Crusade. Avenger Metz, for example, still uses the Argent Dawn tabard instead of the newer Argent Crusade one.

name: Argent Squire
how_to_get: Argent Squire is obtained through card packs and crafting. Argent Squire can be crafted with 40 Arcane Dust. Argent Squire can be disenchanted for 5 Arcane Dust.
cardtext: Divine Shield
flavourtext: 'I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos.' - The Argent Dawn Oath
strategy: Argent Squire's low mana cost and divine shield generally allow you to deal 2 damage for 1 mana, potentially killing 2 separate 1 hp minions in the early game. During the midgame, if you are playing a deck that makes use of Blood Knight, this card can potentially act as a +3/+3 buff for 1 mana, leaving you with a 1/1 minion as a bonus.
lore: Argent Squire is a throwback to an obtainable pet in World of Warcraft. Argent Squire is acquired when you become a Champion of your race during the Argent Tournament. This item summons an Argent Squire which can carry the banner for any faction that the player has earned the right to Champion. When becoming champion of all races, you will be able to buy a mini horse for the squire, which will reward you with an achievement, and which will enable your squire to go to the shop, mailbox, or the bank for you, with a 4 hour cooldown. Handy for when you're in a dungeon and need materials for spells, or if you forgot that quest item in the bank. Remember when he returns he needs 4 hours of rest before he can go shopping again. The design for the squire, including an overstuffed backpack and a banner, may be an homage to the squires in the popular movie 'Monty Python and the Holy Grail.'

name: Assassin's Blade
how_to_get: Assassin's Blade is obtained through card packs and crafting. Assassin's Blade can be crafted with 40 Arcane Dust. Assassin's Blade can be disenchanted for 5 Arcane Dust.
flavourtext: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin. Certificate of authenticity included.
strategy: This Rogue's weapon associated with Blade Flurry that can easly overtake the table. Mainly, if potentiated with Deadly Poison or Wicked Knife. Most players avoid to spend its durability until it has Deadly Poison on it.

name: Bananas
how_to_get: The only way to receive Bananas is if the opponent plays King Mukla, whose battlecry places two Bananas cards into your hand.
cardtext: Give a friendly minion +1/+1. (+1 Attack/+1 Health)
strategy: These enchantment cards are there to counter King Mukla's unusually low 3 mana cost, compared to his 5 attack and health.

name: Barrel
how_to_get: This card cannot be obtained by players.
cardtext: Is something in this barrel?

name: Barrel Toss
cardtext: Deal 2 damage.
strategy: This direct damage card can be played directly on the opponent's hero or on any enemy minion. Useful for finishing off already damaged enemies or as an early board clearer.

name: Battle Rage
how_to_get: Battle Rage can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.
flavourtext: 'You won't like me when I'm angry.'
strategy: Battle Rage draws a card for every damaged friendly minion or hero, giving this ability a potentially large card output. If you have a lot of minions on the field, you could play Whirlwind in conjunction with Battle Rage and draw a substantial amount of cards. Players often find themselves with a lack of cards in their hand and Battle Rage has the ability to turn a match around or further secure victory.

name: Bear Form

name: Betrayal
how_to_get: Betrayal can be obtained through card packs, or through crafting.
cardtext: An enemy minion deals its damage to the minions next to it.
flavourtext: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.
strategy: Minion placement becomes important when playing against a rogue. The reason for this is betrayal allows them to use your high attack minions as a 'bomb' to take out the minions next to it. Alternatively if you are playing as the rogue you can use an opponent's mistake in placing minions to take out powerful adjacent minions.
